title: The Killer Mustang of the Knicks
description: Once upon a time, like last season, the New York Knicks strutted through the National Basketball Association with the elegance of thoroughbred race horses or at least working jumpers. But now they've got a mustang in their midst. They would prefer to rope and brand Mel Davis, just for their own safety under the boards. But they don't dare. They've got to give Mel Davis his head, and his shoulders and his elbows. No matter who gets trampled. If the Knicks are safe, opponents would be safe, too. And the Knicks can't be that choosy anymore. The Knicks probably will qualify for the National Basketball Association playoffs under the new formula that includes the Eastern Conference's best thirdplace team. It's whispered that the new playoff formula was devised to assure that the Knicks and Los Angeles Lakers qualify in their seasons of transition, but the Lakers need a formula for a lastplace team. All the Knicks need is a better wonlost record than either the Houston Rockets, their opponents today at Madison Square Garden, or the Cleveland Cavaliers, whichever team finishes third in that division. To lump the Knicks, after all their glory years, with the Rockets and the Cavaliers explains what they are now. It also explains why they need their mustang.

title: SOVIET SAID TO ASK LISBON FOR A PORT
description: LISBON, Jan. 31The Soviet Union has made an urgent request for port facilities in Portugal for its Atlantic fishing fleet, according to official Portuguese sources. An agreement to grant the facilities would, in the view of some Portuguese officials, constitute a major breach of the Atlantic alliance security on the approaches to the Mediterranean and in the South Atlantic.

title: Art: Giacomo Manzu's Role in Religious Sculpture
description: One of the curiosities of recent art history is the reputation of Giacomo Manzu. As the son of a sacristan, Mr. Manzu may be said to have been born to the service of the Roman Catholic church. As early as 1939, with a series of reliefs on the subject of the Passion of Christ, he claimed for himself the status of a big fish in what was, then as now, the very small pond of modern religious art. With the commission in 1949 of bronze reliefs for St. Peter's in Rome, and with the installation of those reliefs in 1964, it was believed by many people that after more than 500 years Italian art had found a second Ghiberti: someone who rivaled the great Florentine master as a storyteller in low relief.

title: People in Sports
description: Dwight Davis of the Cleveland Cavaliers got so annoyed by a heckling fan in Cleveland's Coliseum Thursday night that he jumped into the stands to argue with his tormentor. The fan had berated Davis for his failure to contain Buffalo's Bob McAdoo. I don't want to say anything about it. It was just one of those things, Davis said. Coch Bill Fitch added, I looked up in the stands and turned around, and it wasn't until 60 seconds later I realized it was Dwight Davis up there arguing with the fan. There was no foul or other call from the referee after the incident, and Fitch said he did not plan any disciplinary action. I guess it's something that every professional athlete would like to do, but shouldn't, Fitch concluded.

title: CAREY IS CLEARED ON ELECTION FUND,
description: ALBANY, Jan. 31One of two Republican charges of fiscal misbehavior by the CareyforGovernor campaign was rejected today by the State Board of Elections.

title: Suspect Is Held in Death Of Chamberlain's Nephew
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 30 (UPI)An unemployed laborer was picked from a police lineup today as the man discovered cleaning a bloody carpet in the apartment of the slain great nephew of former British Prime Minister

title: Miss Baugh's 68 Leads by Stroke
description: MIAMI, Jan. 31 (UPI)Laura Baugb, posted a fourunderpar 68 today to take a onestroke lead in the first round of the $40,000 Burdines invitation golf tournament. The 19yearold blonde got off to a shaky start but then carded six birdies and a bogey over an eighthole span in the middle of her round.

title: Year's Earnings Up
description: Net income of the Continental Oil Company fell 30.8 per cent in the fourth quarter of 1974 but rose 35 per cent for the full year, the company reported yesterday.

title: City Adopts Orphans
description: Thousands of New Yorkers offered money, toys, medical services and clothes to help the six young children of Frank J. Walker, who were orphaned Wednesday when a gunman Shot down their father in St. Vincent's Hospital.

title: Notes on People
description: Carter Heyward of New York and Suzanne Hiatt of Philadelphia, 2 of the 11 Episcopal women whose ordination as priests last year was later held invalid by the church's bishops, will join the faculty of the Episcopal Divinity School in Cambridge, Mass. They will take their turn in chapel, functioning as priests, the dean of the school, Harvey H. Guthrie Jr., said yesterday.

title: Cyprus Talks: Pact Seems Distant
description: ATHENS, Jan. 31  The good news is that the Cyprus talks have started a wellinformed Western diplomat said. The ban news is that they aren't getting anywhere.

title: 2 Under Fire Are Replaced in First Shuffle of Giscard Cabinet
City Adopts Six Orphaned Children
description: Thousands of New Yorkers offered money, toys, medical services and clothes to help the six young children of Frank .7. Walker, who were orphaned Wednesday when a gunman shot down their father in St'Vincent's Hospital.

title: Low Altitude of Doomed Plane Frightened Flight Controller
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31 (UPI) A veteran flight controller said today that he was frightened last Dec. 1 by a dangerouslY row altitude radar signal from Trans World Airlines flight 514, but was unaware of the existence of a mountain that the plane hit 95 seconds later.

title: State Pension Chairman Is Resisting Carey's Plans to Abolish His Bureau
description: ALBANY, Jan. 31The chairman of the State Pension Commission said today that he would ask the Legislature to save his group from the abolition threatened in Governor Carey's proposed budget.

title: Appeal Barred In Kapp Case
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 31 Federal District Judge William T. Sweigert issued a brief order today formalizing his sweeping Dec. 20 opinion that held the National Football League's contract and player reserve system illegal, and denied the league an immediate appeal, which would have stayed the decision.

title: Miss Nelson, 103, Dies; Confined for a Century
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 31 (AP) Martha Nelson, who was committed to a state mental hospital for unknown reasons in 1875 at the age of 4 and spent the next 99 years in state institutions, died yesterday, according to the Ohio Department of Mental Health and Mental Retardation. She 103 old.

title: F.C.C. Denies Renewals For Five Radio Stations
description: WASHINOTON, Jan. 31 (AP: The Federal Communications Commission denied today license renewals for five radio stations owned by Don Burden in Indianapolis, Omaha, Neb., and Vancouver. Wash.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Geiberger Leads by Stroke
F.C.C. to Begin an Inquiry On Better TV for Jersey
description: The Federal Communications Commission yesterday voted to begin an inquiry into ways to provide adequate television service for New Jersey, which has no major commercial station within its borders although it is one of the most populous states in the country.

title: $1 Oil Import Fee Begins With Ford Critics Divided
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. With Congressional Democrats unhappy about President Ford's: energy program but undecided about an alternative, step one of the plan, a fee of $1 a barrel on imported crude oil, goes into effect tomorrow.

title: Open Interest
description: Friday, January 31, 1975

title: Owner of 2 Nursing Homes Is Barred as Administrator
description: The owner of two condemned nursing homes who failed his examination for license as an administrator was enjoined yesterday from employing himself in that capacity.

title: Juvenile Care
description: Among those involved in the general effort to help children in need of assistance in New York State there is a broad consensus that the facilities for serving juveniles are strained and outmoded. Beyond shared fears and apprehensions, however, the consensus ends.

title: FARM PRICES DROP 3D MONTH IN ROW
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31 (UPI) Farm commodity prices dropped another 1.5 per cent in,the month ending Jan. 15 as wheat, corn and soybeans declined again, but the decline is not expected to stop the continued rise of retail food prices, the Agriculture Department reported today.

title: 2 Afternoon Papers Shift To Weeklies in Florida
description: COCOA, Fla., Jan. 31 (AP)The closings of two fiveday, afternoon newspapers in Brevaru County, The Evening limes at Melbourne and The Star Advocate at Titusville, were announced today.

title: Idfaho Man Dies at 106
description: LEWISTON, Idaho, Jan. 31 (UPI)William E. Kauder, 4. the age of 106 Idaho's oldest citizen, who once said he probably had the best voting record of anyone in the nation, died,. yesterday at a local nursing home. Mr. Kauder, a homesteader and a lifelong Repub. lican, voted in 21 consecutive Presidential elections.

title: BondsNamath Duo 2d in Airlines Golf
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Jan. 31New York's newest golfing duo, Joe Namath of the Jets and Bobby Bonds of the Yankees, combined for a 14underpar 57 today in the first round of the American Airlines golf tournament, which pairs a baseball player with a football player in handicap format.

title: State Sues the V.A. To Keep Financing Independent Study
description: The State Education Department sued the Veterans Administration yesterday to keep the Federal agency from applying new regulations that the department maintains would limit or altogether halt benefits paid to veterans in independent study programs, such as the Regents External Degree Pro tram.

title: Bella Lange, Calligrapher Of U.N. Treaties, 85, Dies
description: Bella Brodeur Lange, a calligrapher who in 1947 spent three months transcribing the official copies of the United Nations Treaties in English, French and Spanish in engraver's script, died yesterday in a nursing home in Ossining, N.Y. She was 85 years old and lived at 117 East 37th Street.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An srticle in The New York Times yesterday said incorrectly that the Seaboard Coast Line Railroad was not among the lines that petitioned the Interstate Commerce Commission for a freight rate increase. Most of the nation's railroads, including Seaboard, asked for the increase, which was denied by the commission.

title: Fallen Heroes
description: The perverted adulation that once greeted gunmen who terrorized innocent air travellers has finally faded in the Arab world. Following the lead of several Arab governments, the Palestine Liberation Organization has now at last found political sagacityleaving out any moral considerationsin condemning random terrorism instead of glorifying it.

title: Dr. Leonard Reissman, 53, Cornell Sociology Head
description: Dr. Leonard Reissman, chairman of the department of sociology at Cornell University, died in Ithaca, N.Y., on Wednesday at the age of 53.

title: Books of The Times
description: Enderby, the poethero of Anthony Burgess's new novel, is old, ugly, fat, dirty, dyspeptic, lecherous, greedy and uncompromisingjust like his own conception of Western culture. Enderby is a poet and he would say that civilization is a poetic form, as opposed to a rational one. He finds this form increasingly threatenedespecially in New York Cityby the erosion of language and the free verse of liberalism.

title: DOCTOR DISPUTES ABORTION METHOD
description: BOSTON, Jan. 31Dr. Kenneth C. Edelin, on trial here for manslaughter in connection with an abortion, frowned on the witness stand as he stared at the photograph marked as Exhibit No. 10.

title: EXPERTS DEBATE DIABETES REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31Witnesses before a Senate subcommittee gave differing opinions today on the question of whether another wide study should be organized to settle serious questions concerning some drugs widely used by diabetics.

title: IranPays99Nillion For 6 T.W.A. 747's
description: Trans World Airlines, which has been buffeted by financial troubles, announced yesterday that the Iranian Government had bought six of its 19 Boeing 747 jumbo jets for $99

title: Amtrak Train Is Derailed Near Huntington. W. Va.
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., Jan. 30 (AP)An Amtrak passenger train with some 180 passengers and crew aboard was derailed early today, injuring two persons slight.ly and tearing up a quartermile of track.

title: Duke of Norfolk,66,Dies; Led Britain's Pageantry
description: LONDON, Jan. 31The Duke of Norfolk, the country's premier nobleman, who had the hereditary duty of supervising great pageants of state, wed last night in his house on the grounds of the ancient family me of Arundel Castle in Sussex. He was 66 years old.

title: SOVIET SAID TO ASK LISBON FOR A PORT
description: LISBON, Jan. 31The Soviet Union has made an urgent request for port facilities in Portugal for its Atlantic fishing fleet, according to official Portuguese sources. An agreement to grant the facilities would, in the view of some Portuguese officials, constitute a major breach, of the Atlantic alliance security on the approaches to the Mediterranean and in the South Atlantic.

title: Recital
description: ltzhak Perlman's violin recital at Carnegie Hall on Thursday night turned out to be one of those affairs at which complete strangers smile at one another and shake their heads in happy mutual wonder. Mr. Perlman has been a phenomenal fiddler ever since he appeared on the scene about 10 years ago, but he now has taken the quantum leap into a tiny group of artiststhe names of Rubinstein and Segovia come most quickly to mindwho make audiences fall deeply in love with them.

title: Brazil Oil Strike Taps a Well of Misgivings
description: CAMPOS, Brazil  This sugar town has abruptly become the center of Brazil's new oil rash and is not at all sure it's a good thing. The recent discovery of a rich offshore oil field is the biggest news in Campos since June 24, 1883, when Emperor Pedro II dedicated what the townfolk say was the first electric light system in South America.

title: FORD'S LAYOFFS TO TOTAL 74,075
description: DETROIT, Jan. 31The Ford Motor Company said today that it would have 74,075 workers laid off next week, 3,600 fewer than this week.

description: Parole After a Year Backed by Court

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Morgan State Five Coach Susnended

description: ATLANTA, Jan. 31 (AP)The National Center for Disease Control said today that the rate of flurelated deaths in the nation had remained above the epidemic threshold for the third straight week last week.

description: Mayor Beame asked the City Council and Board of Estimate yesterday to approve the expenditure of $1.95billion on construction and related activities in the fiscal year beginning next July 1.

title: GUARD IS DOUBLED IN INDIAN SEIZURE
description: SHAWANO, Wis., Jan. 31A National Guard contingent surrounding a vacant Roman Catholic novitiate occupied by armed Menominee Indians was ordered nearly doubled tonight after a day in which plodding efforts for a peaceful settlement went past the deadline and local whites intensified their demands for the use of force to end the seizure.

description: James F. Brady, who headed the estate and trust department of S. D. Leidesdorf Co., an accounting concerns until his retirement last September, died yesterday at the Harkness Pavilion of the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. He was 63 years old and lived at 360 Roaring Brook Road, Chappaqua, N.Y.

description: Manufacturers suffered massive $7.34billion decline in new orders in December while their inventories continued to rise. Details on Page 39.

description: NEWARK, Jan. 31 (UN)Two hundred fortyeight New Jersey Bell Telephone workers lost their jobs today because of the slackening demand for telephone services in New Jersey, according to telephone company officials.

Now It's Men's Turn to Stand Over a Hot Stove
description: Where is your wandering man tonight? He said he was having an evening with the guys. Relax, he's not at the singles bar or at an Xrated movie. He is, bless him. wrapped up in an apron learning to whip up dinner at cooking class.

title: Johns Duo Wins Title In Skating

title: 14 STATES CONFER ON OFFSHORE OIL
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Jan. 31A conference ,of officials of 14 Atlantic Coast states today, produced what Governor Byrne called general agreement on most points of a policy statement on offshore oil exploration. The policy calls for giving the states a greater role in evaluating and planning the development of energy resources on the country's underwater continental shelf.

title: Socialism: The Diamond, Not the Dung
description: The underlying ideal of Socialismdemocracy and equalityis like diamond hidden under a mountain of dung. The simile is George Orwell's, the dilemma that of every Socialist who has witnessed the most barbaric acts committed in the name of this ideal.

description: Horses listed in order of post positions. Letter designates OTB listing. FIRST$4,000, Cl., 4YO and up, 6f.

description: International

title: RULING IS TERMED AID TO HISTORIANS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31 Judge Charles R. Richey's ruling today that the Government owns the papers and documents of former Presidents is likely to have little impact on access to the records of Richard M. Nixon's predecessors. However, the ruling is likely to be important to historians in the future, according to scholars and government experts,

title: Kellems Service Tomorrow
description: A memorial service for Vivien Kellems, the industrialist, will be held tomorrow at 3:30 P.M. at the Goodspeed Opera House in East Haddam, Conn. Dr. Homer Babbidge of Vale University will speak. Miss Kellems, whose home was in East Haddam, died in Los Angeles last Saturday at the age of 78.

title: ICHINOE DANCES GIVE SENSE OF CEREMONY
description: Saeko Ichinoe's dances convey a definite sense of ceremony whether or not they draw directly on Japanese legend, and her company presented It varied selection of a halfdozen at Japan House on Thursday evening.

description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, the nation's largest bank specializing in wholesale banking to the corporate carriage trade, yesterday followed the Chase Manhattan Bank in lowering its prime rate on loans to 9 per cent from 9 per cent.

description: 67 A.M., WNYCFM: Sunrise Symphony. Symphony in B flat, Chausson; Love For Three Oranges Suite, Prokofiev.

title: 1976 BUDGET REVIEW MADE BY PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31 (UPI) President Ford made his final review today of the budget for the fiscal year 1976 to be sent to Congress Monday and told reporters, I never thought I'd sign one this bigor sign any one. really.

title: P.B.A. AND FIREMEN AVERT DISMISSALS UNDER NEW PLANS
description: Three hours after the Police Department had accepted the guns, badges and identifications of 532 young policemen and ordered them laid off, the dismissals were rescinded when the city agreed yesterday to proposal by the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association to have some officers work at times without pay.

description: LEVYEva. Died Feb. 1, 1972. Your granddaughter ?? will know of you.

description: The financially troubled Westinghouse Electric Corporation disclosed yesterday that Tenneco, Inc., had withdrawn from a joint venture to build floating nuclear power plants.

title: Productivity Slump . .
description: The overall efficiency of the national economy declined last year for the first time since the Federal Government started keeping productivity records just after World War II. The 2.7 per cent drop cannot explained away as merely a reflection of the tendency of many employers in a recession to retain more workers than they need, in hope of a quick recovery.

title: . . . Labor Cost Rise
description: But a repetition.in 1975 of anything approaching last year's 14.7 per cent leap .in unit labor costs would have a disastrous impact on even the most vigorous governmental attempt to revive the economy.

description: AMERICAN EXCHANGE (Volume 2,475,865 shares)

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31 (AP) A suit was filed by 21 House !Democrats today to halt United States supply airlifts, reconnaissance flights and any other direct military involvement in Cambodia.

title: GREECE TO ASK U.S. TO RENEW ARMS AID
Reputed Rackets Figure Acquitted in New Orleans
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 31 A reputed local underworld figure, Carlos Marcello, and two other men were found not guilty today of Federal charges that they had conspired through racketeering and extortion to take over a suburban night club.

title: Audubon Society Given Land in Connecticut
description: MONTVILLE, Conn., Jan. 31 (AP)The widow of a New London resident who operated a 60,000acre ranch in Texas has given the Connecticut Audubon Society the largest gift of land in its history.

description: FLAGSTAFF, Ariz. (AP)The most isolated of Arizona's 993 election precincts is Supai Indian village at the bottom of the Grand Canyon.

title: Merger Broker Sees Busy Year
description: Arthur Burck has 20 years of experience as a merger broker. He has probably worked out more large acquisitions from poolside than any other man in the country.

title: CONSUMER AGENDA OFFERED BY NADER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31 Ralph Nader exhorted the leaders of the consumer movement today to redirect their efforts away from legislation on narrow issues and to strive instead for changes that would allow consumers to protect themselves without depending on Government bureaucracies.

title: Indians Give Ford A Medicine Pipe For Country's Ills
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1President Ford now has an Indian medicine pipe to help him solve the country's ills.

title: Design: Some farmhouse
description: Sculptor Constantino Nivola has come long way since he left his native village of Orani in Sardinia, became art director of Olivetti in Milan at 25 and then, in the nineteenthirties, emigrated to America with his wife, Ruth. Le Corbusier, a close friend, painted in Nivola's New York studio during the nineteenforties and fifties. Today, Nivola's sculptures grace buildings designed by Jose Luis Sert, Eero Saarinen (with whom he worked on two dormitories at Yale), Marcel Breuer and Richard Stein.

title: Double Exacta Returns $793.50
description: Action on the Offtrack Betting Corporation's double exacta increased to $385,641 yesterday, but the payoff declined sharply.

title: Holy Cross Downs Seton Hall In Garden Classic Final, 7371
description: George Blaney, the Holy Cross coach, was right. It was a bad time to be playing an emotionally charged Seton Hall basketball team.

title: STAMPS
description: Canada is putting out this Wednesday the first of this year's sets of stamps devoted to the summer Olympic Games scheduled for Montreal in 1976.

title: Audrey D. Scott To Be the Bride Of Eric j. Schou
description: Mary Rachel Scott of Greenwich, Conn., and Harold Bartlett Scott of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Audrey Dibert Scott, to Eric J. Schou of San Francisco. The couple will be wed in San Francisco in May.

title: Tristan Best Poodle
description: A black standard poodle, Fabulous Tristan of Belle Glen, C.D.X.; proved an able substitute for his more illustrious kennelmate, Fabulous Mark 0 Belle Glen, U. D., when he romped off with five trophies at the obedience trial of the Poodle Obedience Training Club of Greater New York yesterday.

title: U.S. Mail: Ziptronic, but Zipless
description: You are seated in front of a green plastic keyboard. Sixty times a minute, a rotating metal arm reaches into a tray of letters and deposits one onto the chain conveyor 16 inches in front of your eyes. You have sixtenths of a second to read the zip code on the letter before you hear the click. Then, within the next fourtenths of a second, you must press the right three keys, like staccato notes on a piano. When a full second is over, rubber finger snaps the letter out of your line of vision and onward toward its intended destination. Simultaneously, the metal arm deposits another letter 16 inches in front of your eyes, and you have sixtenths of a second before you hear another click.

title: McKellen, Miss Hamill Keep Titles in Skating
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Feb. 1 (UPI)  Gordon McKellen Jr. of Lake Placid, N.Y., despite a hard fall, won his third straight senior men's title at the United States Figure Skating Championships tonight.

title: J. D. Robertson Fiance of Stella Miller
description: Mrs. Paul J. Miller has announced the engagement of her daughter, Stella Catherine Miller, to James Douglas Robertson, son of Dr. and Mrs. Douglas Robertson of Mount Kisco, N. Y. An April wedding is planned.

title: The Region
description: The State of New York has begun its own investigation of the nursinghome industry, an inquiry with the authority to take it far beyond the investigation now tinder way by a state assembly committee.

title: ROLLS ROYCENESS
description: LONDON. Less than four years after its own bankruptcy, at a time when Great Britain is almost bankrupt too, and indeed the Western world seems to be skidding toward insolvency, the RollsRoyce Motors Company of Crewe, England, has announced thatit will offer a new model this year, the first since 1965. Will it be a more modest machine than its predecessors? Will it reflect the world's preoccupations with fuel shortages, cash shortages, gulfs between rich and poor? Will recognize our general disillusionment with the internal combustion engine?

title: City Hires 1,500 Under U.S. Program
description: Since Jan. 10, when the federally financed program to provide 5,500 public service jobs for the unemployed was begun here, the city has hired more than 1,500 people.

title: In Latin America, High Hopes
description: RIO DE JANEIROThis is the best place in the world to be, says James F. Waters, general director for LatinAmerican operations for the General Motors Corporation, pointing to Latin America's flourishing vehicle sales to prove his point.

title: 5 Specialties to Launch Westminster Show Weekend
description: The big Westminster weekend starts here Saturday, with five specialties. It was only a dozen years ago that the Rhodesian Ridgeback Club of the United States was the only organization to hare the Saturday date. Then the Chihuahua Club of Metropolitan New York came into the picture and was followed by the Afghan Hound Club of America, and the Knickerbocker Dachshund Club. This year, the Long Island Bulldog Club, for the first time in its three decades, is having an independent specialty and joins the parade, with a show at Belmont Park.

title: Auto Recycling Takes Skill and Patience
description: LOS ANGELES There's a way to beat the high cost of buying a car. It's a way that wpn't appeal to everybody, involves some risk and requires some mechanical skill and the patience to shop around.

title: Bracing for the Arab World's Culture Shock
description: Every day there are American businessmen who land in the Middle East on a pilgrimage they hope will bring them good fortune. They come to sell products, to negotiate feasibility studies for training Saudi Arabians in how to use the technology of the west, to build a projected complex of 100,000 houses in deserts so bare that you can see a rabbit a mile away.

title: Thieves Damage Historic White Plains Courthouse
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 1The old White Plains Courthouse, which was placed on the National Register of Historic Places two weeks ago, is being damaged by scavengers while a Federal court weighs a dispute over its fate.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Hospitals Ready to Admit Patients of Nursing Homes
description: Dr. John L. S. Holloman, president of the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation, disclosed yesterday that municipal hospitals were ready to admit as many as 500 nursinghome patients within three to four weeks to help alleviate a shortage of beds resulting from the closing of some private Manhattan nursing homes.

title: ECONOMIC ROUNDUP
description: The state of the union is not good, declared President Ford in his State of the Union message to Congress this year.

title: Harmonies and dissonances
description: This is not an easy novel to describe. It is something like the movie BlowUp, let us say, in that its hero thinks he spies with a camera what his naked eyes have refused to see. And it is something like the novels of RobbeGrillet in that its prose is deadpan, toneless, under a spell, looped in its own obsessions, words whispering inside the head of a madman. It is like Pynchon's Gravity's Rainbow in that its symbolic and allusive formulae come from science and technology rather than from literature and other art, and in that one reads through it as one might move through sets designed by a secretive and paranoid demiurge. It is like many novels written by authors from Dostoevsky to Michel Butor in that its unexpected harmonies and novel dissonances sound against the conventions of the mystery novel. It is like the recent work of Norman Mailer in its hero's attempt to sniff out and soak up the power, energy, magic or mana released by violence and fear. We are in the grip of forces, says Cartwright, the hero whose mind is the lookout cartridge of the title, "and also of their absence."

title: ARTS ENDOWMENT WEIGHS MUSIC AID
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 Have American record companies  invented quadraphonic sound as a gimmick to resell 19thcentury orchestral music to the public?

title: Alice Robbins, Peter S. Hamlin Planning Bridal
description: Dr. and Mrs. Frederick Chapman Robbins of Cleveland Heights, Ohio, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Alice Christine Robbins, to Peter Scott Hamlin, son of Mrs. Ellen S. Hamlin of Franklin Lakes, N.J. They plan to marry at the Robbins home this summer.

title: Marcia Collins Bride Of Benjamin Russell
description: Marcia Ebin Collins, daughter of Mrs. Everett G. King of Troy, N.Y., and the late Charles E. Collins Jr., was married yesterday afternoon in St. John's Episcopal Church in Troy to Benjamin Harvey Russell, son of Mr. and Mrs. John B. Russell of Rumson, N.J. Canon Frederick E. Thalmann performed the ceremony.

J., was married there yesterday afternoon in the Presbyterian Church, to Peter Wysocki, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kazmier Wysocki of Hackensack, N. J. The ceremony was performed by the church's minister, the Rev. Harry Chase.

title: Furry Animals versus Fertile Acres
description: It started the year after the drought ended. That first spring. when the grass exuberated green and fresh right throtrgh the summer, the rebbits came back from wherever they had been. The groundhogs proliferated gloriously and prodigious groundhog holes appeared overnight all over the hillside and Under the outbuildings.

title: CHESS
description: Probably no other line in any opening has ever gained the widespread acceptance achieved by the Yugoslav at. tack against the dragon variation of the Sicilian defense. In other openings, attention will normally be divided among three or four possible methods of pressing White's initiative, the final choice depending on the style of the player involved, and What he thinks will prove most onerous to this or that opponentBut, when it comes to confronting the dragon, even those who habitually avoid fireworks make the Yugcslav attack an exception.

title: What's Doing in THE NEW ENGLAND SKI COUNTRY
description: THE SEASONBlessed with ample snow and adequate supplies of gasoline in contrast to last winter's shortages of both commodities, New England's ski country has so far enjoyed a good season. The resorts are sticking close to the prices they charged in the financially distressing 197374 season, and this, too, is encouraging business. Lively though the season may be, however, New England weather is not known for its reliability, and if in doubt about ski conditions, phone the area of your choice before starting out. Snow reports on all ski areas are available by phone, tollfree, from the Frank Ellis Ski Reporting Service. In New York the number is 18002436600. In Maine, Vermont, Pennsylvania, Delaware, Virginia and Washington, D.C. it is 18002433430, and in Connecticut 18009923420.

title: SPACE PREPARATIONS READIED,SOVIET SAYS
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 1 (UPI) The preparations for the historic space rendezvous of astronauts from the United States and Sovient Union are being successfully completed, a member of the Soviet crew said today.

title: Metropolitan Museum Sets. Plan To Hire and Promote Minorities
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, reacting to a complaint brought by the New York City Commission of Human Rights, has agreed to undertake an active program of hiring, promotion and related practices in order to increase the number of minority and women employes, it was announced yesterday.

title: TV VIEW
description: The invisible man, this country's black populatim, has at long last achieved a remarkable degree of visibility in the powerful machine of mass communications. The gradual, but startlingly steady, emergence has had nothing to do with chance or the basic goodness of white America. It can be traced directly to the civilrights movements of the sixties and the subsequent formation of black pressure groups demanding a fair share of the imagemaking pie.

title: Miss Rogers Fiancee Of Peter Albert Glover
description: Mr. and Mrs. Bartolomea M. Rogers of Monmouth Beach, N.J., have announced the engagement of Mr. Rogers's daughter, Marianne, to Peter Albert Glover, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Harvey Glover of Locust. N.J.

title: Wings Lose, 41
description: DETROIT, Feb. 1  Lorne Henning scored on a penalty shot, the first ever converted by a New York Islander in the club's threeyear National Hockey League history, and helped coach Al Arbour's team to a 41 victory today over the Detroit Red Wings.

title: When Husband and Home Aren't Enough, Some Women Find Returning to College Is
description: YONKERS, N. Y.On the surface, Virginia Jennison's life looked about as full as a life could be. The 4Iyearold Manhattan housewife had spent 20 years doing volunteer work for churches, hospitals and schools. And then when she got home, she had a husband and six children waiting for her.

title: No Recession in Lilliput
description: Despite reports that the home building industry is at its lowest point in years, at least one builder in Lebanon, N.J. is enjoying record sales. Another in Maine is finding a ready market for his townhouses and Victorian mansions. And sales of period furniture, crystal chandeliers, Oriental rugs, handpainted Chinese screens and other luxurious home accessories, are flourishing.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TOMORROW

title: RetractableControlDeviceBecomesPopular Among Skiers as One of Safer New Bindings
description: It used to be that when a skier went. into a shop to buy gear he usually emerged with brightly colored wooden skis, a pair of stiff, leather boots and warn clothing. Bindings? Few thought twice about having to buy the inthing in those days  viselike, unreleasable beartraps.

title: College Is Assaying Political Terrorism
description: CRANFORDA course in how to deal with political terrorism and organized crime is now under way at Union College. Seventy students, most of them employed by lawenforcement agencies, are enrolled.

title: How to Balance the Budget
description: Hugh L. Carey and Edwin B. Dooley belong to opposing political parties, but both are disturbed about the massive and theatening gap between the income and expenses of New York State and both want to do something about it. Governor Carey, a Democrat, favors firing Dooley, the chairman of the State Athletic Commission, to save his $32,575 salary. Dooley, a Republican, has what he considers a better idea. lie is trying to collect $10,000 and interest for the state treasury from Muhammad Ali and Joe Frazier. Considering how long they have known Eddie, you wouldn't think Ali and Frazier would mind, but they do.

title: PostHip
description: A young man called because he is doing an article about publishing first novels in San Francisco. You mean writing them, don't you? I asked.

title: Computer Creates Art in Watchung
description: WATCHUNG  Art and computers may seem a world apart, but Lillian Schwartz brings them together in her wadi. The New Jersey artist, who has exhibited painting and sculptures internationally, is now experimenting in a film technique that uses the computer as a tool.

title: There's Art in the Led Zep's HeavyMetal Hullabaloo
description: The current recession has made even popland's most successful rock acts wary of setting out on those grandiose tours of yore, but the thunderous English hardrockquartet, Led Zeppelin, has no reason to sing the blues. Soldout signs will greet the group tomorrow night when it lights in Madison Square Garden to launch a sixperformance stand  the longest run ever attempted in the local area by a rock act that has chosen to play only in giantsized arenas.

title: Th. Bst Cr it th Wrld
description: From the beginning, in 190304, F. Henry Royce wanted nothing but the best. The quality, he said, will remain when the price is forgotten. Transferred into today's terms, this means RollsRoyces 8 or 10 years old are worth nearly their purchase price, sometimes more. At least half the RollsRoyces built since 1904 are still running, and many ot them have thrived on the hardest kind of driving. Depredation is negligible: In their old agesay 25 years or sothey are worth more than any other car their age.

title: Governor Perturbed Over Plight Of Farmers
description: TRENTON  Governor Byrne told delegates to the State Agricultural Convention last week that New Jersey needed serious legislative weeding in order to restore its farming reputation.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: The first public meeting of the Garden State Numismatic Association will be held next Saturday. Feb. 8, at the Holiday Inn in Hazlet (on Route 35, off the Garden State Parkway). The meeting, starting at 5:30 P.M., is open to individual collectors as well as representatives of coin clubs throughout the state.

title: Drama Critics Salute Stars
description: PRINCETON  The Paper Mill Playhouse and the McCarter Theater shared top honors in the annual awards presented last week by the New Jersey Drama Critics Association.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: Soybean for Protein

title: Charles Matheson Is Fiance Of Charmian Wallace Turney
description: Dr. and Mrs. Frank Turney of Knoxville, Tenn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Charmian Wallace Turney, to Charles MacLean Matheson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Roderick Matheson of New Canaan, Conn. A July wedding is planned.

title: Escaped Convict Sought on Coast In Slash Deaths
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 1 (UPI) The police said today that they were Seeking as a possible suspect in the nine slasher murders a 32yearold prison escaper who killed a family of fivemostly by cutting their throatsin El Cajon, Calif. 15 years ago.

title: India Names Envoy
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 1Durga Prasad Dhar, who resigned as Planning Minister, has been named India's Ambassador to the Soviet Union, replacing K. S. Shelvankar, who will be Ambassador to Norway. Mr. Dhar, who was Ambassador in Moscow from 1969 to 1971, strengthened SovietUnion ties.

title: 20 BELIEVED MISSING ON BURNING TANKER
description: MARCUS HOOK. Pa., Feb. 1 (AP)Officials held out little hope today for recovery of any of the 20 or so crewmen missing from a Liberian tanker wracked by fire and a series of explosions.

title: Book Ends
description: Book Clubs. Herewith another of our periodic reports on what's doing well (and not so well) at the BookoftheMonth Club and Literary Guild.

title: Motor Calendar
description: Tomorrow Westchester Coretc,: Association meeting at the Canada Lounge. Mamaroneck Avenue and Grand Street. Mamaroneck. N.Y., 8:30 P.M. All Corvette owners welcome. Information: John Pachnen, phone (914)7690597.

title: Daughter to the Emerys
description: A daughter was born on Jan. 19 to Mr. and Mrs. Henry Emery of Denver at the General Rose Hospital there. The child has been named Dawn Ptarmigan. Mrs. Emery, the former Barbara, Sadwith, is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Howard M. Sadwith of Colts Neck, N. J. The child's father is president of the Computer Graphics Company, a subsidiary of the American Appraisal Company.

title: SOUTH ROCKS AGAIN AT MUSIC ACADEMY
description: The South, rock n roll style, rose again Friday night at the Academy of Music on 14th Street. The Lynyrd Skynyid group and the Charlie Daniels Band boogied the evening away, much to the delight of the longhaired countryrockers in the audience who became more and more adept at rebel yelling and whooping as the music wore on.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Elizabeth Quay Sets Wedding
description: Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Calvin Quay of Bloomfield Hills, Mich., and Palm Desert, Calif., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Elizabeth Marie Quay of Boston, to Mark Edwin Andrews 3d of Cambridge, Mass., son of Mr. and Mrs. Andrews of Houston; Fishers Island, N. Y., and County Clare, Ireland.

title: The Damages of Defiance
description: Joe Kapp always called tequila his truth serum. And the more he drank t.hkt night in 1967, the more he recognized the truth that he deserved the blame for the Minnesota Vikings loss to the Green Bay Packers the previous Sunday afternoon.

title: UDEN HATCH DIES; WROTE 40 BOOKS
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Feb. 1(AP) Alden Hatch, who wrote more than 40 books chronicling the lives of personalities from Presidents to sports figures, died today at his home following a brief illness. He was 76 years old.

title: This Week in Sports
description: College Basketball

title: The Truth About Groundhogs
description: Those who depend on Groundhog or Candlemas Day (Feb, 2) for a prophecy on the end of winter had better trust an almanac instead.

title: TRINIDAD BENEFITS FROM OIL OUTPUT
description: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad and TobagoSuddenly, onceimpoverished Trinidad has become the envy of many equally beautiful but economically struggling neighbors in the eastern Caribbean.

title: Cornell Six Triumphs
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 1 Dave Peace, the Cornell cocaptain, scored two goals, including an insurance tally with less than four minutes to play, today as the Big Red defeated Yale, 86, in an Ivy League hockey. game. Cornell, Now With a 1252 wonlosttied record over all (and 43 in the Ivy League, outshot the Ells, 5135. Ron Graber tallied twice for Yale, now 113 on the season and without a victory in five ,Ivy contests.

title: A Green Light for Stocks?
description: Last week the Dow Jones industrial average soared 37 points on record volume. Why? What attracted so many buyers to the longsick stock market  and all at once?

title: DANCE VIEW
description: Let us sit down and ponder the return of two natives, Glen Tetley, on temporary leave of absence from Europe, and Suzanne Farrell, back permanently we trustalthough no one has actually stated this  to the paternal fold of New York City Ballet. We all know about prophets being without honor in their native lands. In conversation I once mentioned this cliche to Sol liurok, who mused for half a second and said: And often honor is without profit. But the case of Glen Tetley is an unusual one.

title: Camaro and MonzaA Tale of Two Prices
description: DETROIT Would an automobile company put a higher price tag on a smaller car than it would on a bigger car, especially if the two cars were aimed at the same market and the smaller car had less passenger room, less speed and less luggage room than the larger. car?

title: CYPRUS ARTIFACTS TERMED IMPERILED
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus  Greek Cypriote officials are worried that valuable antiquities are being smuggled out of the Turkishoccupied sector and sold abroad.

title: Yesterday's Hero Wants His Auto Back
description: While waiting in the long lines on alternate days to pay 53 cents a gallon for regular gasoline early last year, it began to dawn on me that the fuel shortage might be serious.

title: Horsewoman of Year Switched From Classroom to Showring
description: Back in the early nineteensixties when she was teaching English at Rosemary Hall in Greenwich, Conn., the last thing in Mrs. Max Richter's mind was to become a professional riding instructor. Mrs. Richter not only left the teaching profession to concentrate on coaching young riders, but she also produced the winner of last year's Maclay Trophy, Alex Dunaif, at the National Horse Showone of the most coveted prizes in the country for junior riders. Two months later she was awarded the Martini and Rossi Trophy as Horsewoman of the Year for 1974 in the nationwide balloting by the American Horse Shows Association. Mrs. Richter lives in Greenwich with her husband and two young sons. She opFarm.

title: W. A. Hanley Jr. Weds Elise A. Kenny
description: Elise Ayres Kenny, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lyman Ayres of Indianapolis, was married there yesterday afternoon to William A. Hanley Jr., son of Mrs. Hanley, also of Indianapolis, and the late Mr. Hanley. The ceremony was performed in Trinity Episcopal Church by the Rev. G. Ernest Lynch.

title: FOOD SUPPLIES UP AS HARDHIT LANDS FIND SOME RELIEF
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 The world food picture has improved sharply in the last two months, most notably for India. This changed picture has emerged from interviews with Government officials and other experts here and from data from United States and United Nations sources.

title: RAISE PROPOSED IN JOBLESS BENEFIT
description: The State Industrial Commissioner, Louis L. Levine, says his personal feeling is that the maximum weekly unemploymentinsurance benefit in New York State should be raised to $125, from the current $95.

title: PENN AWARDS B.A. TO I.F. STONE ('28); University Honors Newsman Who Dropped Out in 27
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 11. F. Stone, the iconoclastic journalist, became an Ivy League alumnus today in oneman graduation ceremonies here at the University of Pennsylvania.

title: Making Virtues of Necessities
description: WASHINGTON  President Ford has submitted Congress a package of proposals to revive the depressed economy and to make the United States less dependent on imported oil. There is general agreement that an early tax cut is desirable, but there is much disagreement about the energy aspects of the package. The following questions and answers explore the energy issues.

title: Washington's Telephonic Pied Piper
description: ASCRATCHY baritone, accompanied by a sometimes uncertain accordion, emerged from my telephone. The tune was from H.M.S. Pinafore, but the words were about Gerald R. Ford and had a very contemporary ring:

title: Fatal Push in Subway
description: A 25yearold woman was thrown to her death in front of an onrushing subway train in downtown Brooklyn yesterday by a man who apparently was a total stranger. A suspect pursued by witnesses was arrested in the station. Page 43.

title: LETTERS
description: Credit Rein

title: Court Bars a Plant To Handle Waste In Dutchess County
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 1A State Suprome Court justice nullified a zoning athendment passed last month by the Town Board in Dover that would have permitted the construction of a major landfill and garbagerecycling facility in the Dutchess County community.

title: Legislative Notes
description: TRENTONFor the first time within anyone's memory here, Senate Democrats opened to the press last week their heretofore secret party caucus. But they followed that session with a closed meeting to decide whether reporters should be barred from subscouent caucuses.

title: TANKER OIL SPILLS BY 1985 ASSAYED
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP)  If oil spills from tankers keep pace with world petroleum production, as much as five million metric tons of oil will be added to the marine environment annually by 1985, the Smithsonian Institution says.

title: Gromyko Sees Syrians
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Feb. 1 (UPI)Foreign Minister Gromyko arrived here today and met with Foreign Minister Abdel Halim Khaddam for 2 hours and 15 minutes. The Syrian minister later held a dinner in Mr. Gromyko's honor.

title: Gallant Bob's 3d in Row Is Victory in the Burch
description: BOWIE, Md., Feb. 1 Gallant Bob extended his winning streak for the year to three in capturing the $27050 W. P. Burch Stakes today. Taking the lead at the start of the sixfurlong sprint for 3yearolds. Gallant Bob carried the silks of Robert Horton to a 4length score Pendulum Sam.

title: For Only $200:
description: LOS ANGELES  A. few months ago Harold Rathbone, who is 76 years old and lives in La Habra, Calif., bought a 1932 RollsRoyce Phantom II Seclanca Coupe for $200.

title: Heatley Traded to Racers
description: ST. PAUL, Feb. 1 (UPI) The Minnesota Fighting Saints announced today that Murray Headey has been traded to the Indianapolis Racers for a future trade conside,ration. In 22 games this year, Heatley had 5 goals, and 9 assists, for 14 points, and 31 minutes in the penalty box.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Three persons were critically injured when a twostory frame house in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn burned and collapsed after having apparently been set afire by the explosion of an acetylene torch, according to a Fire Department spokesman. The injured were identified at Thomas Pensabene, 58 years old, and his daughteer, Rosemarie, 23, both of 3913 Avenue K, where the explosion and fire occurred at 9 A.M. and Angelo Somer, 56, of 418 Henry Street, Brooklyn, a plumber and friend of the Pensabenes. The spokesman said the explosion occurred while Mr. Pensabene, owner of the house, and Mr. Somer were working with the torch in the basement.

title: Confession of a Musical ShelfRobber
description: This is the story of the great shelf robbery  with musical overtones.

title: Women Alone Are Helping One Another to Cope With Life
description: COMMACKA strong, articulate woman in her 60's, Alice has been widowed for 20 years after a 15yearlong marriage made in heaven.

title: Mr. Beanie Blames the Red Ink on Outside Forces
description: Last June, when Mayor Beame was completing his $11.1billion expense budget, he insisted it couldn't be cut. Any reduction, he warned the City Council, would mean cutting into vital city services. The fiscal year is only half over, that budget is already sinking in a sea of red ink, and although the Mayor is now making the cuts he warned against, clearly the worst is still to come.

title: Music: ABoulez Evening
description: Pierre BouTez's evening with the JuilHard Orchestra in the Lila Acheson Wallace Visiting Artists Series at Tully Hall on Friday night found the conductor cast in what appears to be one ofhis favored rolesthat of missionaryeducator in the field of contemporary music.

title: The World
description: A number of developments have provided important clues to the emerging strategies that will be pursued by oilproducing and oilconsuming nations as they prepare for a meeting, apparently not far off, where they will try to deal with the economic dislocations caused by high petroleum prices.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Editor:

title: New &Novel
description: The Leavetaking

title: The torment of Ulster
description: BELFAST. The harsh, incongruous, often surreal qualities of life in tormented Belfast are hard dislodge from memory. There was the nicely dressed man in the pub off the Catholic Falls Road who told a visitor he had been in New York City, and marched in the St. Patrick's Day parade. He made good sense for about five minutes and then whispered: Want to come back to my place and hear some tapes of a British soldier being shot?

title: Cosmos Set For Indoors Tournament
description: With or without George Best, the New York Cosmos will play in the North American Soccer League's Group II indoor tournament Thursday and Saturday in Rochester. The New Yorkers, who have been practicing indoors for the last week, will take a 12man delegation to Rochester to meet Hartford on Thursday night.

title: A guide to contemporary music
description: For those who would like to catch up with what the modern American composer has been doing, a list of representative recordings follows. It is not a list of the best"; nor can it be comprehensive  limitations of space compel the omission of many notable works and composers. Institutions such as Aaron Copland, Leonard Bernstein and Charles Ives are omitted, having entered the mainstream of our culture. The list is, simply, a sampling.

title: Draft Seems Big Help to Colts and Rams, but No Help to Eagles and Chiefs
description: Which of the National Football League's 26 teams were able to improve themselves in last week's draft of 442 college seniors? And which ones found the draft to be nonproductive. Answers will not come until September when the last squad cuts are made and the rookies have been exposed. However, an initial assessment is possible regarding goals achieved in no way attained.

title: Rain Sets Golf Back One Day
description: HONOLULU, Feb. 1  The third round of the $220,000 Hawaiian open golf tournament was canceled today because of the flooded condition of the Waialae Country Club course. An allnight rainstorm, punctuated by thunder and lightning, created what the players were calling the Aquatic open over the Casual Water Country Club.

title: SmallCar Sales: Surge Isn't Over
description: DETROITIt seems almost a quaint memory now: Millions of Americans waiting in line for hours to buy gasoline, their tempers and frustrations rising, and hundreds of thousands flocking to dealer showrooms to trade for small compacts and smaller subcompacts.

title: TeambyTeam Player Selections in N.F.L. Collegiate Draft
description: ATLANTA FALCONS

description: International

title: Miss Errath Wins Skate Title Again
description: COPENITAGEN, Denmark, Feb. 1 (UPI) Christine Errath of East Germany won the women's title for the third successive year tonight at the European figure skating chain. pionships.'The 18yearold East Berlin student produced an electrifying performance in the final freeskating category to overtake Californiaborn Dianne De Leeuw of the Netherlands. Anett Poetzsch of East Germa fly was third.

title: Fat Fees And Free Speech
description: John Dean is in a class all by himself, says Mr. Dean's booking agent. Any way you look at it, it's hard to argue with that. Financially, for example, Richard Nixon's former counsel, fixer and nemesis has been out of the pen only sinca Jan. 10 and already his take is crowding a halfmillion.

title: McKew Still Has Eye on Harwood Post
description: The Nassau Democratic chairman, Stanley Harwood, survived a bizarre challenge of his leadership last week but it appeared likely that dill more challenees lie ahead.

title: NassauRoslyn Pact to End the Discharge of Sewage Into Hempstead Harbor
description: MINEOLA  The daily discharge of a halfamillion gallons of treated sewage effluent by the Village of Rasrim into Hempstead Harbor and Long Island Sound will be ended as a result of an agreement reached last week between Nassau County and the Villaee.

title: July Nuptials Set By Miss Van Ingen
description: Elizabeth Wilds Van Ingen of Manhasset, L. I., and Schuyler Van Ingen of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Allison Van Ingen, to Ralph A. Bankes Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Bankes of Armonk, N. Y. A July wedding is planned.

title: Phnom Penh Surviving Another Rebel Offensive and Blockade
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Feb. 1 Two more cargo vessels reached this capital with badly needed rice yesterday, having made it through the gantlet of cannon and rockets that the Cambodian insurgents maintain along the banks of the Mekong River.

title: Long Island Office Building
description: Purolator Services, Inc., will move Its international headquarters this summer from three locations in Lake Success, L.I., to this new office building at 3333 New Hyde Park Road in North Hills, L.I. The company, a courier, armored car and security guard service, has leased 58,000 square feet in the fourstory structure, which is owned by XCell Realty, Inc., of Manhasset. It was designed by Michael Harris Spector & Associates. Sperry Construction Corporation of Manhasset was the general contractor, and Wm. A. White & Sons was the broker in the 10year lease, which has an aggregate rent of about $5million. The company is moving out of about 35,000 square feet at 2 and 4 Nevada Drive and 3000 Marcus Avenue in Lake Success.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Good Mechanics Are Hard to Find
description: DETROIT Despite soaring unemployment, there's at least one big help wanted sign outfor auto mechanics.

title: A Sleek Black Shadow Lurks On Formula 5000 Race Scene
description: With a break or two, Don Nichols could field winners in two of the most glamorous motor racing series in the world. Nichols heads the 130P Shadow racing team, and in one series the globe  hopping FormulaOne circuit  he thinks it's only a matter of time before he has a winner. The other series is the American Formula 5000, and although his team has no previous experience in it, he feels he has the right combination to be a winner. Nichols got used to winning last season when his sleek, black racers dominated the CanadianAmerican Challenge Cup Series for unlimited horsepower cars.

title: Alex Nieroth to Wed Miss Waldbauer
description: Mayor and Mrs. Robert T. Waldbauer of Patchogue, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Pamela Joan Waldbauer, to Alex Nieroth, son of Mr. and Mrs. Cyrill Nieroth of Upper Montclair, N.J. A spring wedding is Warmed.

title: Few Flight Delays Cited In Perilous Cargo Protest
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP)  Only a few short delays of airline flights were reported today in the Ni.ake of a pilotimposed ban on toe transport of hazardous materials in passenger aircraft.

title: Late Briton's Diary Assails Laborites During 64 Crisis
description: LONDON, Sunday, Feb. 2 Labor Government leaders were faced today with a new installment of the embarrassing diaries of the late Richard Crossman, published in The Sunday Times of London.

title: Calendar of Dog Shows
description: TodayMidIsland K. C. allbreed match, Nassau Coliseum, Uniondale, LI.; entries from 8:30 A.M. judging 12:30 P.M.

title: Cunningham's New Frontier: Videotape
description: For three decades, choreographer Merce Cunningham has surprised audiences with his ceaseless experimentation. Last year he embarked on yet another surprising adventure, abandoning the principle of repertory performances in favor of a series of unique Events. This year he is moving into a completely new area: choreography created expressly for videotape.

title: Bus Aids Elderly in Metuchen
description: METUCHEN  For two years, Mrs. Catherine Schveninger, a 77yearold widowed grandmother, attended the Borough Council meetings in this Middlesex County community. Her goal? Prod the Councilmen into providing free bus service for the town's elderly.

title: Braniff Is Ordered By Peru to Reduce Flights From Lima
description: LIMA, Peru, Feb. 1 The Peruvian military Government has ordered Braniff Airways to cut its flights from Lima by more than half, beginning today, in an effort to increase passengers on Aeroperu, the fledgling state airline.

title: RENT CONTROL LAW AROUSES CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1Rent control has been added to all the problems likely to beset the first elected government under a new home rule municipal charter for the District of Columbia this year.

title: Noncredit Courses Are Slated in Mercer
description: The courses include Beginning Ballet, Japanese Flower Arrangement, Karate for Self Defense, Home Repairs for the Homeowner, Psychology of the Single Parent, Foster Parent Education, Astrology, Book Illustration and College Survival.

title: Miss Quinn Plans Bridal
description: A May wedding is planned by Kathleen May Quinn, a member of the class of 75 at the Harvard Medical School, and Russell A. Maurer, who is enrolled in a combined M.D.Ph.D. program at Harvard.

title: ARMORED VEHICLES ORDERED TO ABBEY
description: SHAWANO, Wis., Feb. 1 Gov. Patrick J. Lucey today ordered an unspecified number of armored personnel carriers to gird the area around a Roman Catholic abbey, which has been occupied by armed Menominee Indians since Jan. 1.

title: Ford Wants $300Million More for Saigon
description: WASHINGTON  The passion over Vietnam seems mostly gone, drained in the interminable argument. But the old politics and attitudes remain behind the scar tissue; the American soldiers are gone, but the war won't go away, and therefore neither will the issue.

title: 7 Seasonal Cannery Workers Sue Teamsters Over Pensions
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb, 1Seven retired seasonal cannery workers filed a class action lawsuit in Federal District Court this week alleging that they receive either no pensions or minimal pensions because the Western Conference of Teamsters administers its pension plan illegally.

title: Answers/Questions
description: A: IVY PROBLEM (Jan. 5) Ms. P.T., a Philadelphia, Pa., reader has al several hanging plants of ivy which are thriving, but rather than hang down the vines curl back to themselves. She wondered why and what to do. Perhaps the ivy baskets are near a source of heat causing them to curl back on themselves, or they are responding to the light conditions present. The ivies could be moved to a new location to see if the plants correct their growing pattern and hang naturally downward. Ed.

title: High Court in Philippines Upholds Marcos's MartialLaw Regime
description: MANILA, Feb. 1 The Philippine Supreme Court today endorsed the martiallaw regime of President Ferdinand E. Marcos by ruling that he was President in fact as well as by law.

title: Ideas & Trends
description: Countries without the technology or the money to install their own communications satellite systems are now leasing, or applying to lease, spare channels on the orbiters operated by the International Telecommunications Satellite Organization (Intelsat). One channel can carry either a TV program or hundreds of telephone circuits.

title: AN INQUIRY BY HOUSE IS URGED ON AGNEW
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. I (UPI)  A freshman Representative called today for a Congressional investigation into the, getrichquick career of former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew.

title: 5 Dead in Chicago Fire
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 1 (AP) Four small children and their grandfather perished early today in a fire in a oneroom South Side apartment. Fire officials said James Webb, 58, years old, was babysitting when the fire broke out. The other victims were identified as James and Paul Webb, 10months old twins; Samella Webb, 11 months, and her sister Kaussaundra, 2.

title: Dutch Consul Kidnapped In Colombian City of Cali
description: Bogota, Colombia, Feb. 1. (Reuters) Erik Leupin, the Dutch Consul in Cali, Colombia's third largest city, was kidnapped at his country home outside the city yesterday.

title: Card of Chanks
description: WACHSBERGER  Fannie H. To My beloved fam MY heart's gratitude for your un. wavering love. To my friends North and South, thanks for your solicitude.

title: Jazz Notes: New Clubs and A Big Band Bash
description: Jazz clubs are opening and closing in New York at a furious rate, but the portents are good, with openings far ahead of closings. Two clubs opened just before the end of the year  St. James Infirmary at 22 Seventh Avenue South and Sweet Basil just couple of blocks away at 88 Seventh Avenue South. Then two clubs closed in the first two weeks of the new year: The uptown Half Note on West 54th St. and Buddy's Place, named for Buddy Rich, on Second Avenue. Both rooms will become discotheques  but they have provided the seeds for two new jazz clubs. Mike Cantarino, who with his brother, Sonny, started the Half Note in 1957 at Hudson and Spring Streets and moved uptown with it in 1972, will step across 54th Street to become manager of a new club called Eddie Condon's. Red Balaban, the bass player, whose sixpiece band, Balaban and Cats, will be the house band, hopes to be ready to go at the end of the

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: Many amateur photographers find that most of their picture taking at this time of year is limited to indoor shooting  and to most this means some type of flash. Fortunately, there is a wide range of easytouse equipment from which he or she can choose. Here is a roundup of the most widely used forms of flash equipment, along with some timely pointers on how to insure good results with each.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Jimmy Connors on the status of his romance with Chris Evert: You never can tell. It's far from over because I was crazy about her when I was 19, I Was crazy about her when I was 22 and I'll probably be crazy about her when I'm 82.

title: A Convicted Narcotics Dealer Found Guilty in Model's Death
description: A convicted narcotics dealer has been found guilty in Federal District Court here of violating the civil rights of a model by murdering her three years ago.

title: Carnival in Rio
description: For a few fleeting days and nights just prior to Lent, Rio de Janeiro explodes into a frenzy of brilliant color, glittering light, gyrating bodies and samba beat. It is CarnivalCarnival in Riowhen anything is possible and everything seems plausible. The poor favelado, or slum dweller, who has scrimped all year so that his lavish fantasia, or costume, can outshine all others, is fabulously wealthy; the women become the most beautiful, seductive creatures in the world. Most dazzling of all are the virtuoso dancers. Their acrobatic variations are madly infectious, and dancing and singing ripple like wildfire through the stands lining the jampacked streets. This year the magical dates are Feb. 811.

title: Argentina Raises Gas Price
description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Feb. 1 (AP)  The Argentine Government today announced price increases of up to 45 per cent for gasoline and up to 66.6 per cent for taxi fares. Gasoline now will cost about $2.20 a gallon for premium fuel and about $1.98 for regular. Costs of public services, including gas, electricity and sanitation, were raised an average of 42 per cent.

title: Sunday Observer
description: In New York they have the Consolidated Edison electrical company. When I lived elsewhere, New Yorkers would come and bore me with tales of this berserk corporate monster, and I would dismiss it as New York hysteria and laugh a bored and torpid laugh.

title: PORTUGAL DENIES SOVIET ASKS PORT
description: LISBON, Feb. 1 The Foreign Ministry officially denied today reports that the Soviet Union was seeking port facilities in Portugal for its Atlantic fishing fleet, but informed Portuguese sources insisted later that the report was valid.

title: A Soviet Jew's Troubles Making It in New York
description: While freedom of emigration is stilly an issue between the United States and Soviet Union, the time has Come to say a few words about how America's absorption of Soviet Jews is proceeding. I was not mistaken about Israel, but about America.

title: MiddleSize Imports Stress Comfort, Not Styling
description: DETROITFour European Cars have captured a small but solid fragment of the United States market. The tourSweden's Volvo and Saab, the German Audi and the French Peugeotaren't small cars in the usual sense, 4uad they're not superexpenSiye or high performance Models, either.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The stock market staged an impressive rally last week In the heaviest trading in the New York Stock Exchange's history.

title: Writing Is a Way of Life for Plain field's DeLeeuw Sisters
description: PLALNTIELD  Between them, the Misses Adele and Cateau DeLeeuw have written 115 books for young people and adults. Their batting average stands at 12 collaboraticms, 58 books for Adele and, as Cateau says. 45 books to my discredit. Also, a number of their works have been translated into 10 languages, including Turkish and Korean.

title: The Royal, RiskTaking Shakespeare Company
description: LONDON.

title: Crosley and Henry j:
description: When my Uncle Morris out in Longview, Wash., heard that KaiserFrazer was going to stop building the Henry J, he bought a second one to have when the first one wore out.

title: For Really Accurate Cuts and Grooves
description: For the home carpenter or woodworking enthusiast who gets interested in building cabinets, storage units, shelves, furniture, play equipment  or dozens of other woodworking projects where accuracy is important  the most useful stationary power tool he can acquire is a table saw. A good table saw. properly adjusted, will enable hint to accurately crosscut, ripsaw. bevelcut or groove all kinds of lumber and paneling to exact sizes.

title: Cape Hatteras Dunes and Fishing Rights Disputed
description: CAPE HATTERAS, N.C., Feb. 1Winter is the quiet time here on the remote sands of the Dare Coast, where the Outer Banks jut 25 miles into tht Atlantic.

title: Criminals At Large
description: The ingredients are familiar: a tough and professional killer employed by a hushhush agency; the head of the bureau sitting back and pulling strings; the expendability of the agent; the cross and doublecross; the fight against odds; the presence of the Russians somewhere along the line; the twilight area where right and wrong become eradicated. By now we should be tired of all this. But does a boll weevil ever get tired of cotton?

title: In Europe, Auto Sales Slump
description: PARISThe problems of the automobile industry are not an American phenomenonthey're almost worldwide. And Europe's troubles are even greater than Detroit's.

title: FRANCE TO STEP UP NUCLEARFUEL USE
description: PARIS, Feb. 1 (AP) France is planning a huge increase in her output of nucleargenerated energy by 1985, while cutting oil consumption by more than 12 per cent, the Government announced today.

title: ELSA OEN DEAD; OPERA SINGER, 94
description: Elsa Alsen, who sang some 200 operatic roles from 1900 to 1935, first as a contralto and then as a dramatic soprano, died Friday at the Morningside Nursing Home at the age of .94.

title: Rebel Leader Adamant
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 1 (UPI)  The Eritrean leader, Osman Saleh Sabbe, said in an interview today that the conflict with Ethiopia would continue until Eritrea was granted independence.

title: Speidel Papers Purchase
description: RENO, Nev., Feb. 1 (UF)  Speidel Newspapers, Inc., has announced the purchase of two Minnesota dailies, the St. Cloud Times and the Little Falls 1Transcript, for $8million cash. The acquisition expands the Speidel group to 13 daily and five Sunday newspapers in nine states, with a total daily circulation of approximately 330,000.

title: AUSTRIAN TV A HIT WITH HUNGARIANS
description: GYOR, Hungary, Jan. 27 By tolerating competition from Western television and radio, Hungary is tacitly forcing her own broadcasting system to become more entertaining and informative.

title: Connally Quits Board of Espionage Review
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (UPI)President Ford announced today the resignation of former Treasury Secretary John B. Connally as a member of the President's Foreign Intelligence Advisory board.

title: FILM VIEW
description: Martin Scorsese, the young New York director whose Mean Streets was such a smashing New York film, has done it again. He hasn't made another New York film, but he's made an equally riveting, entertaining movie that seems all the more original because it is so different from his last one, at least in its immediate concerns.

title: City Parks Productivity Up
description: In the first six months of a Beame administration drive to raise productivity in city agencies, the Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs Administration reports that it has repaired more playground equipment, pruned more trees and made more inspections than it did during the same period a year ago.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: WHILE public attention was focusing mainly on dramatic domestic events last week  the surge of the revived stock market and the tugofwar in Washington in the struggle to fashion some compromises on President Ford's sweeping tax and energy proPosals  little notice was being given to some highly important deVelopments in the sphere of international economics.

title: Leadership Logjam Broken in Trenton
description: TRENTON  A political logjam affecting the Byrne administration and the Democratic leadership in the Asssembly was broken last week with the naming of Richard J. Coffee as the Assembly's new Executive Director. Mr. Coffee will replace Joseph Gannon, who was killed in an automobile accident last September.

title: Nowhere To Turn
description: The most recent evidence shows that the New York region is significantly worse off than much of the rest of the nation in experiencing the effects of the recession. In some places in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, the number of those out of work is higher than at any time since the Depression of the 1930's. The fiscal predicament of the region's governments is beginning to affect services long taken for granted, and even to make small but important alterations in the relationship between municipalities and their employes.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Walton's Friend/ Platooning
description: To the Editor:

title: Lawsuits Feared In Ruling On Police
description: HAUPPAUGE  The State Human Rights Commission ruling last week that the Suffolk County Police Department .was using discriminatory practices by requiring women to pass the same physicalfitness tests as men in applying for jobs as police officers may lead to a series of lawsuits, according to Police Commissioner Eugene R. Kelley.

title: The New Censors
description: The banning or obstruction of lawful speech can never be justified on such grounds as that the speech or the speaker is deemed irresponsible, offensive, unscholarly or untrue. This forthright statement is the heart of a report delivered by a committee headed by the wellknown historian C. Vann Woodward, following an investigation of interference with unpopular speakers on the Yale campus.

title: Alana Lawrence to Be Wed June 7
description: Eileen Alana Lawrence and Pierre W. Dupont, graduates of the Friends Academy in Locust Valley, L. I., and the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, plan to be married June 7.

title: Fighting in Eritrea Capital Is Said to Kill at Least. 20
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Feb. 1 (AP) Ethiopian troops pushed secessionist guerrillas toward the outskirts of Asmara today after at least 20 persons were reported killed by snipers and by mortar, rocket and grenade explosions along the main streets, residents of the provincial capital said.

title: Bergen Schedules 3 Chess Courses
description: PARAMUS  The Division of Community Services of Bergen Community College will offe courses in chess again this spring. The classes, for beginner, intermediate and advanced students, will begin March 13.

title: BMW, Handled by Posey and Stuck, Is Leading Daytona Endurance Test
description: DAYTONA, Fla., Feb. 1 This is not Le Mans. There is a 24hour automobile endurance test here this weekend, but it doesn't have a roller coaster, twoheaded lady or French cooking.

title: Waldheim Leaves on Tour
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 1  Secretary General Waldheim left tonight for a threeweek visit to five countries in Europe and six Persian Gulf countries. He also plans to stop briefly in Greece and Turkey before returning on Feb. 21.

title: Ideas &
description: Each year for the past 141, a goodly number of the great and small problems of the knowable world have been brought together in one broad branching ganglion at the annual meeting of the American Association for the Advancement of Science. This year's theme, Science and the Quality of Life, was stretched like a geodesic dome over six of last week's days and a thousand talks, from Relativity and Human Imagination to Altitude and Fertility to Television As Chewing Gum for Children to The National Hail Research Experiment to Sexual Cyclicity in Captive Lowland Gorillas and Aphrodisias. Among others.

title: Helen Howe, Satiric Monologist Who Became Writer, Dies at 70
description: Helen Howe, novelist, biographer and former monologist, died yesterday at her home, 1158 Fifth Avenue, at the age of 70.

title: RebeccP.Hathaway Engaged To Russell Vincent Lynch Jr
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. E. Phillips Hathaway of Owings Mills, Md., of the engagement of their daughter, Rebecca Phillips Hathaway, to Russell Vincent Lynch Jr., son of Mr. Lynch of Dallas and Mrs. R. Parsons Lynch of New York.

title: Namath Insists Jets Must Make Big Offer
description: PALM SPRINGS, Cam., Feb. 1 I like playing football and I'd like to play for the Jets, said Joe Namath, but they'll have to come up with an attractive enough offer to motivate me. I have to feel it's worth it to do the work, andy it is work, as well as .fun. So I hope it works out. ecause I would enjoy it.

title: Italy Makes Dramatic Comeback To Defeat U.S. for Bridge Title
description: SOUTHAMPTON, Bermuda, Feb. 1A fantastic drive by the defending Italian world bridge team champions brought Ithem victory against North America this afternoon in a final match in which they had seemed hopelessly lost.

title: Miss Tittmann Wed To Shane Nicholls
description: Suzanne Ryerson Tittmann. daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eugene Charles Tittmann Jr. of Darien, Conn., was married yesterday afternoon to Shane Duncan Nicholls of Nantucket, Mass., son of Mr. and Mrs. James Shane Nicholls 3d of Sarasota, Fla. The Rev. Theodore Anderson performed the ceremony in Nantucket's Unitarian Church.

title: Baruch Is First in 3 Races In College Relay Carnival
G.O.P. Leaders on the Island To Fight Carey's Budget Plan
description: ALBANY  The displeasure of political leaders in the Republican suburbs with Governor Carey's proposed $10.69billion state budget is rooted in two areas  the automobile and the schoolroom  and the G.O.P. already is organizing for a lengthy fight.

title: Anne de La Rochefoucauld to Wed
description: Count and Countess Bernard de La Rochefoucauld of Paris have announced here the engagement of their daughter, Anne Patricia de La Rochefoucauld, to John Hayward Manice, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hayward Ferry Manice of New York.

title: Layer vs. Connors: The Hows and Whys
description: Ho hum. The ballyhoo for today's $100,000, winnertakeall tennis match between Rod Laver and Jimmy Connors is ringing in our ears. Yet one wonders who is excited about the outcome itself.

title: Food
