description: MONTCLAIR  John W. Dean 3d, former White House counsel and key witness in the Watergate coverup trial, will speak at Montclair State College Tuesday night. Appearing under the auspices of the College Life Union Board,Mr. Dean will speak in Memorial Auditorium at 8 o'clock.

title: Ideas &Trends
description: Most children of migrant workers bounce from school to school as their parents follow the crops, and soon fail behind in their education. They never acquire any marketable skills and they usually end up following their parents up the road.

title: A Luminous Film Star Moves Into Ibsen's A Doll's House
The Mysterious Images Of Henry Michaux
Preventing Offshore Well Blowouts
description: An offshore well blowout, with crude oil gushing skyhigh, is a nightmare to oilmen and environmentalists alike. It does not happen very often, but the controversy over offshore drilling itself has raised the issue of blowout prevention to the level of political and social concern.

title: Flames Losers To Wings
Article 10  No Title
description: With The Sea Change. H. Stuart Hughes has completed the threevolume survey of 20thcentury European social thought he began in Consciousness and Society (1958) and continued in The Obstructed Path (1968). His trilogy is undoubtedly the most illuminating general study of our century's intellectual history yet produced. What such a judgment means depends on an appreciation of the distinctive challenge posed by 20thcentury Intellectual history, and particularly by social thought, for the historical process has conditioned the dimensions of Hughes's work and goes far to explain its character. His trilogy is both highly selective and engagingly personal: the first quality is required and the second is promoted by the kind of history he writes about.

title: Article 12  No Title
description: The new John D MacDonald, The Dreadful Lemon Sky, is the 16th in the Travis McGee series, the color in the title reflecting yet another shade in MacDonald's spectrum of what in an oldfashioned sense must be called evil.

title: Henry S. Schimmel Dies; Was Justice of City Court
description: Henry S Schimmel, who retired as a City Court Justice in 1955 after 31 years on the bench there and in the Municipal Court, died Friday at his home, 577 Grand Street. He was 90 years old.

title: Japan: Skiing Plus Sukiyaki
description: IT is 7 P.M. after a long day's skiing in the deep powder of Mount Niseko on Japan's northern island of Hokkaido Outside the thermometer is plunging toward zero, and on the mountain is snowmg again, enormous light white flakes. By American custom one should be getting ready for a drink or a reliming dinner. But there is no one in the bar of the Alpine Mountain Lodge; the dining room is closed, and even the huge, steamy public bath is empty. The reasonand this would be true at many of Japan's 600 ski areasis that everyone is still on the slopes, which are floodlit for night skiing.

title: Upstate Man Slain in Bizarre Odyssey
ART VIEW
description: Paul Valery, reflecting on the nature of painting, once spoke of the plurality essential to its existence. The painter, he observed, has brought together, accumulated and assimilated by means of the physical materials of his art, a host of desires, intentions, and conditions coming from all the regions of his mind and being.

title: The Ripple
description: Somewhere down toward the Caribbean there is a ripple of warmth that has started north. It's still too early to call it April, but eventually that will be its name. When it gets going it will travel about sixteen miles day, about the pace of a leisurely man afoot and taking his own good time. Here and there it will pause for a day or even for several days, waiting for the weather to clear. Then it will resume its northward travel.

description: Harry Cole, who retired recently as president of the Harco Juniors Company, women's garment manufacturer, died Friday in Palm Beach. Fla, where he had moved. His age was 67.

description: Pamela Lydia Pinkham, whose greatgreatgrandmother, Lydia Estes Pinkham, fought for women's rights and against women's ailments, plans to be married in June to William MacCalIum Wicker, a student at theHarvard Graduate School of Business Administration.

description: It's after 3:00 on a Wednesday morning, and Herb Jepko answers his phone. The woman at the other end identifies herself and, although he doesn't know her, Jepko grgets her pleasantly and asks how she's feeling.

Child, 3, Killed by Train
description: WARRICK, R.I., Feb. 22 (AP)  One child was killed and another critically Injured today when they were struck by a southbound passenger train. The police said Christopher Green 3 years old, of Bristol, Conn., was dead at the scene.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (AP) Soviet and American cancer specialists have signed an agreement to conduct joint studies on the incidence of breast cancer.

title: Headliner
description: Dr. Kenneth C. Edelin, convicted of manslaughter in the death of a fetus during a legal abortion in Boston, has been sentenced to a year's probation. The sentence, which was announced unexpectedly, pleased the doctor's supporters; it was stayed by Judge James P. McGuire, pending the Outcome of an appeal of the conviction by Dr Edelin. The appeal is based on the premise that Dr. Edelin was denied due process because he was never warned of a possible criminal violation before he performed the abortion However, Dr. Edelin, who is black, also contends that racial and religious prejudice made it impossible for him to receive a fair trial in Boston's Suffolk County. The jurors were all white and predominantly Roman Catholic. Three of the jurors have received threatening phone calls since the verdiet was announced; another had a rock thrown through his window.

title: Journalism Head Named
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 21 (UPI)  Edward Basset has been named director of the School of Journalism at the University of Southern California. Mr. Bassett, 96 years old, was formerly dean of the William Allen White School of Journalism at the University of Kansas.

For years I never left my back porch, she says. Oh, there were outings with the family to upstate New York. Rockland County, that was my big deal. But look at me now I'm in Paris

They went to Canada once, but that was in summer.

description: Gail Adler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. A. William Adler of New York, was married yesterday afternoon to Richard Warren Hughes, son of Mr. and Mrs. James S. Hughes of Pompano Beach, Fla.

title: FILM VIEW
description: The recent opening of Female Trouble, directed, written and photographed by John Waters, the Baltimorean who made Pink Flamingos, prompts the following defense of Bad Taste, which might otherwise get a rotten reputation after being refined with such effective recklessness by master practitioners on the order of Lenny Bruce, Mark Twain, Mel Brooks, the successive staffs of the Harvard Lampoon, Woody Allen and a man whose name I never learned. He was at a recent cocktail party, listening to a woman talk about making one's own mulch, one of the ingredients of which, she said with discretion, was dog poop. Good eavens.

title: Anthony Captures Final In $60,000 L.I. Bowling
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Feb. 22Bill Allen of Orlando, Fla., said, I finished second to the greatest bowler I've ever seen, shortly after Earl Anthony defeated Allen, 217 195, today in the final game of the Professional Bowlers' Association's $60,000 Long Island open.

title: Youth Seized in Slayings Of His Parents and Sister
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 22 (AP) The police arrested an 18 yearold youth today in the slayings of his parents and sister and the attempted murder of his younger brother.

title: 3 Principal Plans
description: WASHINGTONCongress is after the big oil companies again. But this time It is not trying to attack them directly for obscene profits, inventing the energy crisis or any of the other charges leveled against them last year when the full impact of the fivefold oil price rise first struck the country. The approach now is more subtle. Instead of trying to punish the oil companies, the idea is to push the Federal Government Into the oil and gas business.

title: The World From a Wheelchair: Travel for the Handicapped
description: FRIENDS were skeptical when Ruth and John Moline of St. Paul, Minn., announced plans to honeymoon in Hawaii. Both had been afflicted with polio since childhood and were confined to wheelchairs. But the Mohnes did fly to Hawaii, enjoyed the sightseeing, the restaurants, the sunbathing they even splashed in Waikiki Beach's surf with the help of ablebodied companions who carried them into the water.

title: Boy 14, Slays Stepfather After Being Beaten by Him

description: TRENTON  Determination by the Byrne administration to place highranking Cabinet officials in the driver's seat of their state automobile has claimed another victim.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: George Balanchine's Don Quixote nowadays seems to be a dream that has faded, a necessity that has become an excrescence, a hope that has trailed away into a bore. This is Balanchine's most ambitious fullevening ballet, and he put a great deal of himself Into the work. It contains patches of some of his loveliest choreography, and even its concept of a mimetic he roat the center or such a work is brave, and in its way innovative. And yes, the ballet does have at times an atmospheric touch of Cervantes about it. Here is a magnificent concept, and for 10 years I have tried to like the ballet, and at times, perhaps by concentrating more on the aspirations of the piece than its achievements, I have almost succeeded. But enough is enough. Do we have to have Don Quixote revived every year?

title: Innovations Modify Apartment Design
description: The conventional apartment of Manhattan's luxury postwar housing is undergoing subtle adjustments.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: On the heights stand the makers of art with their pointed insouciance: monsters of isolate will, achievers end snobs. wishers for an early death and long posterity. Then, a middle region of breathy good intentionsthe gutsyhieratic diction of A View From the Bridge, the Kerman imperative translated into seven languages Stanley Kramer can speak. Finally the world of the lumpen, condemned to the crude, a longsuffering sigh for Mickey Spillane In Popular Culture and High Culture sociologist Herbert J. Gans accepts the types as given, though, to make things richer and perhaps denser, he gets off a few subcategories of his own. The divisions are mapped out with great sobriety and the additions, like uppermiddle and lowermiddle, clearly mean a lot to Gans.

description: To the Editor:

title: The Seven Days of Creation By Vladimir Maximov. 415 pp. New York: Alfred A. Knopf. $10.
description: When The Seven Days of Creation began circulating in unofficial journals in Leningrad and Moscow several years ago, it provided widely divergent opinions. While some readers acclaimed Vladimir Maximov's talent, others denounced the idelogical content of his novel as too reactionary. Presently, his American publishers are hailing The Seven Days of Creation as a monumental novel and calling Maximov a worthy successor to Pasternak gad Solzhenitsyn. Unfortunately, Maximov dimishes his artistic achievement with clumsy melodrama and unambiguously didactic commentary. At the same time, however benign or foolish he allows the party members to appear, his hatred for Soviet Oonununism suffuses the book, making it easy to understand why the authorities first expelled him from the Union of Writers In 1973 and then exiled him to Europe the following

title: Encounter: Heaven Smiles, But Even Here the Smile Fades
The Final Word
description: J. C. Snead after winning the San Diego open, his first golf tour victory in nearly three years: It's a meat feeling to win again. I don't care if it's the Popcorn open.

title: EGYPT WILL STUDY VAST WATER PLAN
description: GENEVA, Feb. 22Ten years ago an Egyptian graduate student studying in Paris conceived the idea of using pipelines instead of the Nile River itself to carry the water source behind the Aswan High Darn into the Nile Valley irrigation system.

description: The purpose of college changes with the times In the nineteenfifties, college issued certificates that determined who got the good lobs. You went to college to get ticketed into the good life Uppermiddle income, psychoanalysis, two cars in the garage, a chat at offices on the top floor with a secretary who said you were in conference when you were sleeping off the luncheon martinis.

title: Saigon Reports Grenade Kills 8 at District Town

title: European Security

Moscow is familiar with the old French saying: In diplomacy, nothing is more permanent than the provisional.

Kennedy proposed legislation yesterday that would provide a sixmonth moratorium on arms sales to Persian Gulf states while the Administration and Congress reassess Americans arms policy in the region. title: Momoyama: Essence of Japanese Style
description: The Metropolitan Museum's new exhibition, Momoyama: Japanese Art in the Age of Grandeur, should please just about everybody. Orlentalists will recognize why the 79 objects in the show are of such importance that they had to be granted exit visas by the Japanese Diet. Some of them can't even be seen on their home ground unless the right strings are pulled in Tokyo or Kyoto. But for an audience with only a secondary interest in the rarity of these paintings, ceremonial objects, theatrical costumes and masks, gold and black lacquer wares and tea ceremony paraphernalia, the exhibition offers visual delights Independent of any background knowledge. The philosophical exercises and unfamiliar religious figurations that usually stand in the way of a lay Westerner's full appreciation of oriental art were submerged during the Momoyama period under a decorative opulence that no eye can misinterpret.

I never had trouble finding a job before., he said.

title: Wendy Baron, W.C. Frank Jr. Plan Nuptials

title: New & Novel

Stockholm Statuary
description: Less than a halfhour from the center of Stockholm are the villa and terraced gardens of Carl Milles, Sweden's noted sculptor. Against a backdrop of carefully tended trees and shrubbery in the fiveacre Millesgarden are about 100 of Milles heroic figures: some soar from 30foothigh pedestals, many are larger than life, and others form part of detailed fountains.

description: MIAMI, Feb. 22  Everything came up roses in the Black Helen Handicap at Hialeah today, but Allen Jerkens's bouquet proved much sweeter than Tommy Kelly's.

description: Roxy Music, the highly contemporary British rock band, made its third New York appearance on Friday night at the Academy of Music on East 14th Street, and it was an altogether impressive performance.

title: Article 13  No Title
description: On the one hand we have the Malthusian nightmarea plundered, people  packed planet hurtling through space like an I.R T subway at rush hour. On the other, we have our reproductive ethic'; our collective pity for the childless couple, and our loud applause for the quiz show contestant who says I'm the mother of seven children.

title: Man From NASA
Article 4  No Title
description: This large picture book seems to be directed toward children of a tender age; the illustrations, in flat, stylized paintandcollage, have the flavor of kindergarten easel, and generally emphasize the farcical or pathetic aspects of the poems. If Brecht's verses were uniformly simple, this orientation might be appropriate, but in many cases their techniques are relatively oblique and their implications beyond the experience of the very young. On the other hand, several of the verses are pure silliness, and older children capable of appreciating irony or social commentary might well be put off by such banalities as a hen's buying false teeth or the personification of hairs in a moustache.

title: It Has a Growing Constituency in World Affairs
description: PARISDetente, when you think about it, is like knitting. To knit, you need some yarn and two needles. But a better result is achieved by using several strands of yarn and three or four needles. In the beginning, detente was purely SovietAmerican and it flowed from a single negotiation, that which was to lead from the Moscow Treaty on limitation of nuclear testing to the Nonproliferation Treaty and to the Strategic Arms Limitation Talks.

title: Article 11  No Title
description: Upstairs, Downstairs, is over for the season, and the mournful gap left in Sunday evenings can not be filled, even by watching the reruns. The sad truth is, the further the television series gets from High Edwardian times, the less breathlessly we await another installment. The steady decline of Empire, Family and Standards the Bellamys et al. are resolutely illustrating is interesting, but it is no longer fun. It is a long and painful goodbye

title: Brooklyn Arena Study Halted

description: FRENCHTOWN, N. J.Ava Tinfo is critical of only one aspect of the house he built here last year, a cedarshingled box set into a craggy knoll that is a hill or two away from the Delaware River.

description: The Rev Thomas Marshfield, 40 years old, father of two, exjock, recently become a sexual athlete, is distracted. Such, at least, is the official diagnos.s In his own eyes, he suffers from nothing less virulent than the human condition. For recuperation, or retraction from his condition, whatever it is, he has been sent by his (unidentified) church to a resort for wayward clergymen.

description: CHICAGO, Feb. 22  Leon Jaworski, the former Watergate special prosecutor, said today that he hoped that former President Richard M. Nixon would do some soulsearching about Watergate and then make a statement to the American people giving them the truth.

title: Youth an Advantage in Frostbite Sailing
description: Jon Dobson tugged at his Norwegian sailors hat, adjusted his snowsuit and watched his father rig the sailing dinghy. At 5 years old, Jon is a veteran crew. In the light airs on Manhasset Bay, where the first hardy souls started frostbite racing 23 yearsago, the temperature hovers in the high 20's. And at the Port Washington Yacht Club, skippers and crews of the 20 or so Penguins that race each Sunday stepped masts and emptied sail bags.

title: Nassau Community College Opposes Moving Drug Center Onto Its Campus
description: GARDEN CITY  Despite the opposition of the administration and student and faculty leaders at Nassau Community College, Nassau County is moving ahead with its plan to relocate a residential drug rehabilitation center to two buildings on the earnPus.

Or even formidable!

title: The Boxer and the Man in Dark Glasses
TV VIEW
description: Aguideline to watch television by: what you see is not what you think you see. There are the obvious examples. Commercials can turn watery soups into hearty meals, overflowing with huge chunks of meat that are really slivers photographed in gigantic closeup. Blockbuster movies are edited. The deletions may be minimal. but the fact remains that the movie is no longer the same product that was seen in boxoffice theaters.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: The last time Herbert Bienstock had good news for his fellow New Yorkers was in January, 1967. As New York regional administrator for the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics, one of Mr. Bienstock's jobs is to report monthly on the Consumer Price Index for this areaNew York City, Long Island and northern New Jersey. In January, 1967 the index went down, but it has gone up ever since. Last Friday he reported a respiteit didn't go up and it didn't go down.

description: TRENTONTwo measures designed to reduce the soaring costs of prescription drugs in New Jersey have been introduced in the Legislature. The bills would authorize pharmacists to substitute a generic drug for thespecific brandname one prescribed by a physician.

title: Diplomacy: On the Road To Anachronism
description: WASHINGTONThere Is a sense in Washington that Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger is losing some of his remarkable grip on American foreign policy. Rebuffed on his Cyprus policy and trade questions, facing a bitter fight with the irreverent new Congress on the supplemental appropriation for Vietnam, Mr. Kissinger appears suddenly vulnerablea mixed blessing in a Government. where admirable leadership is otherwise so rare.

title: Norwich Sextet Wins
description: NORWICH, Vt.. Feb. 22 (AP) Dominating the hockey game from the start, Norwich University beat Colby College, 74, today. Mike Stevenson had two goals, while Cam McGregor, Lnu Dimassi, Jeff Baldwin. Phil Coleman and Jim Segar each scored once for Norwich.

title: Quake Strikes Aleutians
description: PALMER, Alaska, Feb 22 (AP)A strong earthquake has shaken the western Aleutian Islands southwest of the Alaska mainland, the Palmer Observator reported The quake, which occurred late yesterday, registered 6.6 on the Richter scaleIts epicenter was 60 miles east of Amchitka island in an area of largely uninhabited small islands. There were no immediate reports of damage.

It is focused onthe Snobob, an American  built contraption made up of a bicyclelike metal frame, handle bars, a banana seat and two short skis. Introduced on a minor basis four years ago, the Snobob's popularity continues to grow here.

The police said that Luciano Nieves, 43 years old, of Miami, had been hit by at least six 45caliber bullets

title: 12 Killed on Two Packed Trains In HeadOn Collision in Norway
description: LILLEHAMMER, Norway, Feb. 22 (AP)Two passenger trains packed with almost 1,000 passengers collided headon today, killing 12 persons and badly injuring 20 others in Norway's first major train wreck in almost 25 years, authorities said.

title: Rockefeller's Aide Is a Happy Man: He Loves the Senateand His Boss
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Some men love duck hunting, some men love women, some love football games, and some peanutbutter sandwiches. And some men love institutions: H. Spofford Canfield loves the United States Senate.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: When the subject of the Metropolitan Opera is raised in musical circles these days, everyone seems agreed that the company has two basic needs: more money and more stars. About the first, few people would care to argue. About the secondwell, I'm not entirely convinced. Ever since the Met first opened its doors in 1883, the star system has been the accepted method of conducting business around the house, but during the past few seasons we have not been exactly deluged with stellar casts, and perhaps the time has come to reexamine the concept in the light of current operatic realities. Of course the Met should pursue the finest vocal talents available, but what the company needs now is not more stars: it needs something quite different, an approach to opera production that has been reflected in this winter's three new presentations but more of that later.

title: News Summary and Index
The Danger Facing Africa
description: KHARTOUM, SudanContemporary Africa's three most tragic conflicts have all been fought in that broad geographic band where an Islamic, Arabized northern population shares common statehood with more southerly races of different religion and culture. This has been true for Nigeria, the continent's most populous country; the Sudan, its largest, and now of Ethiopia, its oldest independent nation.

title: Stage: Puerto Rican Traveling Theater at Home
To be young, gifted and blind
description: Stevie Wonder, alternately playing two futuristic musical instruments and occasionally Joining the several conversations which swirled about him, sat in his tiny, crowded dressing room composing, music. He was writing a song tentatively titled If Your Mama Could See You Now, even while the dressingroom door kept swinging open to admit his fiancee, his halfbrother, his manager, his wardrobe mistress, his sound men, friends, reporter and some members of his band. Each had come into the roam to ask some urgent question, to impart some delicious bit of news, to seek his advice or simply to watch. And although he talked to everyone who came, laughed and even joked, he was clearly elsewhere, absorbed in some vision as the sounds emerging from the pianolike clavinet and the harplike symbolet began to assume the melodic pattern he wanted.

title: A.D.A. IS ASSAILED AS A PAPER TIGER

title: Indiana Wins Title, Loses Top Scorer
Article 3  No Title
description: Snow White is so familiar story that with a slight shift of perspective, it can seem very strange. A folktale which has traveled a circuitous route through the Brothers Grimm, dozens of translations, a Disney film, and a stunning 1972 picture book by Randall Jarrell and Nancy Ekholm Burkert, the story still remains mysterious. A queen sits by a window sewing, pricks her finger, and watches blood fall into the snow. She wishes for a child as white as snow, as red as blood, and as black as ebony. The child is born, only to be persecuted by a jealous stepmother. She flees to the protecting home of seven dwarfs who mine gold from the mountains. The stepmother, in a variety of disguises, finally suceeds in murdering her with a poisoned apple But she does not dieshe sleeps. The young girl is placed in a glass coffin by the dwarfs and brought back to life by the love of a young king Because of her punty, she wakes.

title: Exterminating the Wolf
description: The temporary Injunction of an Alaska state court is all that is now preventing bold hunters safely perched in airplanes from killing off 50 to 80 per cent of the wolves in a huge area south of Fairbanks. No one pretends to know with any assurance how many of the animals are left in this heavily forested region of 8,000 square milesmost of it Federal land. But even if the kill amounts to no more than 150 wolves, the action planned by the state's Fish and Game Department preposterous and the precedent appalling. It must be stopped.

title: Miss Hobson Wed To H. I. Robinson
description: Margaret Dodge Hobson, daughter of Mrs. I rederick Leopold Haack of Dhahran, Saudi Arabia. and the late John Barnfathei Hobson 3d of New Orleans, was married in Natchez, Miss., yesterday afternoon to Harold Ivens Robinson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Wesley Robinson of New Orleans. The Rev. Louis Thomas performed the ceremony in Trinity Episcopal Church.

title: G.A.O. CHALLENGES 111MILLION PLANE
Butane Lighters Recalled
description: McCrory Stores has recalled some 33,600 imported butane gas cigarette lighters from 700 stores across the country and ordered them destroyed on the ground that they are a poten tial fire hazard Joseph Banks, an attorney for the parent McCrory Corporation in York, Pa said yesterday that the recall had been ordered after incidents in four stores in which a lighter flamed up, The Associated Press reported.

title: Income Tax Called Way To End Bias In Housing
Late Television Listings
description: The following information about today's televsion programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Seaver Pinpoints Problem
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 22  You're darned right, I'm anxious, Tom Seaver was saying today as three more baseball camps sprouted on the Guf Coast of Florida. You're talking about a career, maybe shortening it physically. But I'm cautiously aggressive about repairing last year's damage.

title: FollowUp on The News
description: When LingLing and HsingHsing, the gift pandas from the People's Republic of China, arrived at the National Zoo in Washington in April, 1972, it was widely reported that they were 18 months old and would beeligible for offspring by the time they were three. That would have been in the fall of 1973, but a baby panda has yet to be born.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The first page of this section last Sunday carried a photograph of a duck that was labeled a black buffalo head duck. The caption erred, as many readers pointed out, and as the following letters indicate. The duck depicted was a drake (male) wood duck; it was not a buffalo head duck (there is no such bird), and it was not a bufflehead (there is such a bird, but we did not publish a picture of it). We intend to duck any further criticism.

title: G.A.O. CHALLENGES 111MILLION PLANE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The General Accounting Office has challenged a conclusion by the Defense Department that a proposed airborne command post could function effectively in directing an air battle over Europe.

title: Turnpike Hotel Still a Sandlot
description: RIDGEFIELDIt was just about 18 months ago that the New Jersey Turnpike Authority and the Marriott Corporation unveiled the architect's rendering of a 300room hotel to be built here in the wedge of the easterly andwesterly segments of the toll road.

title: Theater Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: A Basque Festival Of Brawn
Garden State Plaza Will Enclose Mall
description: PARAMUS  The Garden State Plaza, the oldest and one of the largest shopping centers in North Jersey, is scheduled for a $20million expansion and facelift. The project is designed to enable the plaza to stay competitive with the covered shopping malls that have been built in the area in the last few years.

title: Andrus S. Thorpe Will Marry Edith Lynne Davenport in May
Judge Rules Out Sentencing
description: MALDEN, Mass., Feb. 22 (AP) Malden District Court Judge Louis H. Glaser says he will not sentence any more offenders to the reformatory at Concord until conditions improve there.

title: Easter Seal Drive Picks Dover Girl
description: NEW BRUNSWICKTracy Cole, 10yearold daughter of Mrs. Donna Dabb of Dover, has been named the 1975 Easter Seal Child.

title: The Fountains of Basel: Not Larger Than Life but Part of Life Itself
description: Whatever their intrinsic beauty, historic significanceor artistic worth, too many public fountains in major cities are grandiose architectural set pieces, lavishly sculpted, dominating whole plazas or squares, taking on artificial lives of their own as tourist attractions, divorced from the lives of the neighborhoods around them. Not so in Basel. Most of the 160 public fountains that adorn Switzerland's secondlargest city retain human scale and add a charming intimacy to the urban landscape. In many styles, from various eras, in stone and bronze, some gaily painted, they pop up everywhere and unexpectedlyalong crowded shopping streets, in quiet little courtyards, at tram stops, in the shadow of modern overpasses. A chestnut vendor setting up his stand will lean his umbrella against one. They are that kind of fountain. Best of all, many can be seen on a single outing. Each pictured here was spotted during one 90minute stroll.

title: Not Cloris Leachman Again!
description: LOS ANGELES Cloris Leaclunan is everywhere. Most successful actors have careers that lead them bumpily along a single line until at last they find the one good part that establishes them in the public consciousness; they then repeat this endlessly until rigor artis sets in. Not Cloris Leachman. She plays everything, from slapstick to high drama, and occasionally even sings for her supper, in a bright, clear, very welltrained soprano that brought her a Broadway lead the first time she over auditioned with it. This Wednesday evening she stars in Someone I Touched, an ABC Movie of the Week, in which she portrays a housewife and expectant mother whose supposedly happy marriage is shattered when it turns out that her husband has been hiving an affair with a girl who has syphilis. Clods is so versatile, In fact, that people are beginning to complain that she is too much with as. Oh, Godl a man sitting behind me at Young Frankenstein, exclaimed, Not Clons Leachman again!

title: L.I.Sponsored Folk Oratorio to Premiere in St. Patrick's Cathedral Tonight
description: If the pews of St. Patrick's are more than usually populated by Long Islanders tonight at 7:30, it will be because the Cathedral on Fifth Avenue is serving as an honorary Nassau County cultural center for the premiere on Alan movnaness's folk oratorio The Way of Jesus.

title: John R. Crews of Brooklyn, 80, G.O.P. Leader for 38 Years, Dies
description: John R. Crews, who had been the Republican leader of Brooklyn for 38 years before his retirement in 1970, died yesterday afternoon in Good Samaritan Hospital, West Islip. L I. He was 80 years old and lived in Islip and at 25 Monroe Place, Brooklyn.

title: S.O.R.C. Is Feeling The Little Stinger
description: MIAMI, Feb. 22  The trouble with Stinger, the yellowsided little ocean racing yacht, is that she sails too fast. That goes for others of her ilk, the 36foot sloops that fall into the bottom or near bottom of the handicap ratings, which are the heart of the ocean racing sport.

title: New Civil Court Plan Protects Consumer Credit Defendants
Mexico: Pilgrimage
description: ABOUT 185 miles northwest of Mexico City Is a primitive village of some 300 Mexican Indians. It Is called Atotonilco (pronounced Ahtoetoeneelco) and its chief reason for existence is its 18thcentury Spanish Colonial church, the Sanctuary of Atotonilco, a famous spintual retreat that draws more than 50,000 pilgrims a year who seek to uplift the spirit by penalizing the body.

title: Twixt Wins Again In Bowie's Fritchie
description: BOWIE, Md., Feb. 22 (AP) Twilit returned to racing with a flourish today at Bowie, rallying to win the $59,000 Barbara Fritchie Handicap by two lengths over a longshot, Crackerfax.

title: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Schultz
Bob Hope Says Nixon Seems in Need of Rest
description: PALM DESERT, Calif., Feb. 23 (UPI)Richard M. Nixon spent yesterday evening with friends at the estate of Walter H. Annenberg, former Ambassador to Britain, before returning to the seclusion of his villa at San Clemente.

title: France and Iran Sign Pact
description: TERERAN, Iran, Feb. 23 (AP)  Iran will give France $1billion credit in return for technology and facilities for enriching uranium under agreements signed here today. The accords had been negotiated during the recent visit here of Premier Jacques Chirac of France.

title: AFLC.I.O. URGES FEDERAL CONTROL OVER OIL IMPORTS
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 23 Top leaders of the A.F.L.C.I.O. proposed today that the importation of oil be taken away from private industry and, placed in the hands of Government.

title: Brazilians Look for Motive In the Hijacking of Airliner
TV: Weather Machine Is Effective and Clear
description: For two hours this evening from 8 to 10 on public television  the British Broadcasting Corporation offers a detailed treatise on the subject of weather. Filmed in 14 countries, The Weather Machine examines clouds, wind patterns, ocean currents and water temperatures.

title: Article 1  No Title
Man, 93, Dies, 15 Firemen Are Hurt in West Side Blaze
description: A 93yearold man was killed and 15 firemen were injured yesterday in a predawn fire that destroyed an Upper West Side apartment building and left 36 families homeless.

title: Mrs. Meir Tells Of a Secret Trip To Germany in '67
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 23 (AP)  Golda Meir, who once vowed never to set foot in Germany, returned from West Berlin today and disclosed that she had been in Germany before.

title: 500 Lbs. of Marijuana Are Seized in Brooklyn
description: Two police officers searching a Brooklyn tenement for prowlers yesterday afternoon walked through an open groundfloor rear door and discovered 500 pounds of marijuana in an apartment that had been transformed into a wholesale marijuana outlet, the police said.

title: New Commodity Law Rankles Brokers
description: With the Commodity Futures Trading Commission Act of 1974, the Government is moving deeper into regulation of the commodity futures business.

title: Fire in Iowa Kills 4 Girls
description: NORDWOODVILLE Iowa, Feb. 23 (UPI)An early morning house fire of unknown cause killed three sisters and their 11yearold babysitter today in this community north east of Des Moines, fire officials said. The dead were identified j as Jody Howard, 7, and her sisters Carrier Jean. 3 and Jane Diane. 2, and the babysitter, Linda Wood.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: WORDS AND MUSIC A semesterlong festival of free concerts featuring the music of Joseph Haydn and lectures by wellknown Haydn scholars opens a Monday series tonight at 8 o'clock at the City University Graduate Center, 33 West 42d Street, in the thirdfloor studio. The series, presented in conjunction with a special Haydn research seminar for doctoralstudents, is being offered in anticipation of the Haydn Festival Conference scheduled for the fall at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington. For detailed program information: 7904395.

title: GUERRILLA SLAIN ON RAID IN ISRAEL
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 23 The commander of a group of Palestinian guerrillas on a mission to capture hostages in northern Israel has been killed in a clash with Israeli troops, according to a guerrilla communiqu.

title: HIGH COURT ASKED TO BAR FEEFIXING
PENTAGON FEARS CAMBODIA'S FALL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger said today that Cambodia would absolutely fall into Communist hands if Congress did not provide the $222million in military aid requested by the Administration.

title: Political Gifts in 1972 Pose a Knotty Issue
Consumers Are Warned Of Botulism Threat
description: JERSEY CITY, Feb. 23 (UPI)The Federal Food and Drug Administration and the New Jersey Department of Health warned today that an Egyptian specialty food called fascih or boore, might contain a deadly type of botulism.

title: Apathy Prompts Concern on Capital Needs Panel
description: NEWARK, Feb. 23For the last two weeks, Governor Byrne's Commission to Evaluate the Capital Needs of New Jersey has been meeting here with little publicity to evaluate where and how the central thrust of state government should turn in the next decade, and the lack of public attention is causing some concern.

title: Gurney Trial Opens Today Over Political Slush Fund
description: TAMPA, Fla., Feb. 23 (UPI) Former United States Senator Edward J. Gurney goes on trial tomorrow on charges that he sold Federal mortgage insurance guarantees to builders in exchange for contributions to a political slush fund

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An offduty Transit Authority police officer was shot in the chest early today when he attempted to quell a fight in Pampy's Bar and Grill in the Stillwell Avenue Arcade at Surf Avenue, beneath the tracks of the BMT subway station in Coney Island.

title: Accord on Insurance
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, Feb. 21  An agreement has been drafted in talks here, preliminary to next Wednesday's meeting in Washington, that would provide United States Government insurance for private American investments in Saudi Arabia, according to American sources.

title: Hood Battling Former Assistant for Southern Ocean Racing Title
Historic Opportunity
description: The U. S. Senate has an opportunity today to consolidate a fundamental change which reformers in both parties have struggled to achieve for a generation. This reform would relax the Senate's stringent profilibuster rule and make it easier for the democratic principle of majority government to prevail.

title: 2 to 1 in Poll Oppose U.S. Arms for Mideast
description: By almost 2 to 1, Americans in an opinion poll conducted for Time magazine oppose United States arms sales to either Israel or Arab states.

title: A Key Angolan Rebel Joins Rival Group
description: LUANDA, Angola, Feb. 23 One of Angola's important black nationalist leaders, who had been struggling to take over his liberation movement, has announced that he and his troops are joining a rival liberation organization.

title: Bench Loses A Friend, 5
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Feb. 23 (UPI)Johnny Bench's friend, 5yearold Philip Buckingham, never got his piece of the wedding cake the Cincinnati Red's catcher wanted him to have.

title: City Opera Offers Figaro With Four New to Their Roles
description: Mozart's The Marriage of Figaro was given by the New York City Opera at the New York State Theater on Saturday night with a cast that included four singers new to their roles.

title: Three Auto Makers Head Toward Big Losses for First Quarter
description: DETROIT, Feb. 23  The United States automobile industry, which last week completed reports on its worst year for profits since the 1958 recession, appears to be in for worse trouble in the current quarter, according to some industry analysts.

title: Legal Redress Sought For Arabs Pressure
description: Recent attempts by Arab financiers to discourage participation by Jewish interests in underwritings and other investments have caused a ferment in government and legal circles in New York and Washington.

title: Stein Unable to See Carey on Extension For Inquiry Panel
description: Assemblyman Andrew J. Stein, who heads the state commission that has uncovered scandals in the nursinghome industry, said yesterday that he had failed in his attempt to meet with Governor Carey so he could ask that the commission's life be extended to investigate other matters.

title: 150 on S.I. in Rally for Last Chance Pond
Letters to the Editor
description: Muggers, Victims and Cowards

title: Port Authority Described As in a Model Condition
LABOR HEADS PLAN MARCH TO CAPITAL
description: Labor leaders in the metropolitan area are planning a mass march on Washington as the centerpiece in a broad program to mobilize workers behind proposals to combat the recession and achieve social and economic justicc.

title: Port Authority Described As in a Model Condition
description: The chairman of Governor Carey's task force on transportation has found the books and internal practices of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey in model condition and sees no need for any sweeping overhauls that critics of the huge bistate agency have proposed.

title: FitzSimons Posts First Golf Victory
ExOperative's Account Called Distorted or False by the F .B .I
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 23  The Federal Bureau of Investigation said today that an account by Joseph A. Burton of his activities as an undercover intelligence operative for the bureau was distorted or false.
